title: reiko_holinger
body:
An original character from the [[Gundam 0079 Card Builder]] arcade trading game. Reiko and her rival Catharine Blitzen are the game mascots. Like other original game characters, she can take role of a secretary and interact with player during gameplay, although she is a secret character and isn't available from start.

Reiko's hobbies are reading manga and playing video games. She also likes to ride her bicycle.

She was designed by [[Yoshizaki Mine]].
other_names: レイコ・ホリンジャー

title: sanzu_river
body:
The Japanese Buddhist tradition / folklore equivalent of the River Styx in [[Greek mythology]]. "Datsue-ba":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Datsue-ba and "Sai-no-Kawara (Riverside of Sai)":http://www.onmarkproductions.com/html/sai-no-kawara.html are both related to this river.

Unlike [[charon_(mythology)|Charon]] in Greek mythology, the name of the ferryman of the river is unknown. This is because according to old legend, the dead did not cross by boat, but they walked across the river on foot. The only thing that is known is that the fee for the ferryboat was [i]"rokumonsen (six mon coins)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_mon_%28currency%29][/i], this is why on the Japanese (Buddhist) version of "joss papers":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joss_paper] there is a drawing of six mon coins. This symbol was also used as "Sanada clan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanada_clan]'s emblem.

h4. Notable examples

* [[Touhou]] series - [[Onozuka Komachi]]'s workplace. See "Touhou Wiki":[http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Sanzu_River].
* [[Jigoku Shoujo]] - You can add this tag for the pics of [[Enma Ai]] paddling a boat. Note that she is also associated with some normal rivers in the mundane world.
* [[Samurai Sentai Shinkenger]] - Their antagonists, called "Gedoushuu":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gedoushu], are evil spirits born from the river. And their resident, "Rokumon-sen (Six-Gates Junk)":[http://powerrangers.wikia.com/wiki/Rokumon_Junk] is a wordplay for six mon coins.

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sanzu River":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanzu_River

title: ark_order
body:
Chinese gacha game. Launched in September 27th, 2018; it ceased operation in May 17th, 2021.

Set in the year 2353, it was themed around the world's mythos. Featured collaborations with [[No Game No Life]], [[Hololive]], [[Date A Live]], [[Gochuumon wa Usagi desu ka?]], [[VSinger]], [[Shoujo Shuumatsu Ryokou]], [[Kagura Mea]] and [[Clannad]].

The character artwork has four phases, save for skins, collab characters and "dark persona" forms.

title: nakamori_nanaka
body:
Nakamori Nanaka (仲森 奈々華) is a fledgling Taimanin, that has just graduated from Gosha Academy.

She was introduced in [[Taimanin RPGX]]. Designed by [[Saijou Satoru]].

She has a cheerful and positive personality, but she has a tendency to rush into battle without thinking twice when faced with an enemy.

Nanaka is a hard worker and has a cheerful attitude towards everyone, and is well liked by her friends, who follow her even in dangerous situations.

h4. External links

* "Taimanin Wiki: Nakamori Nanaka":https://taimanin.fandom.com/wiki/Nakamori_Nanaka

title: vox_akuma
body:
[b]Vox Akuma[/b] is a [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber]], from the fourth wave [[Luxiem]] and drawn by [[Lam (Ramdayo)]]. 

His character is a demon feudal lord from the Sengoku era of Japan, reawakened in the modern day, having lost the ability to speak Japanese.

Vox reached 1 million subscribers on July 24th, 2022. He is the fourth member of Nijisanji and the first member of the EN branch to reach this milestone.

Vox has [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair|black]] [[multicolored hair|and]] [[red hair]]. He has [[yellow eyes]] with [[red eyeliner|red]] [[makeup]], and he's [[flat ass|more than a bit lacking in the cake department]] (much to his immense dismay).

title: eight-tailed_fox_nari
body:
Nari is an eight-tailed fox sage.

She is born missing a tail and uses her bead to use magic. She grew up training with the nine-tailed fox, Garam. Because of her missing tail, she lacks magic powers and trained with the help of Garam. While in a long sleep in the form of a stone statue, she was awakened from desperate rituals and prayers from villagers asking for help.

She does want to allure everyone with her cute and adorable looks but detests being treated like a child. She bluntly plays the role of a cute kid, but when the opponent falls for it and treats her like one, she becomes instantly angry for thinking of her as a naive kid. Because of her short temper, she tends to be unexpectedly frank.

She may look like a child, but she has lived long ages. She speaks plainly to everyone and tends to blow on her own trumpet, which often makes her appear like a repulsive child. She's very wise and acts as the sage, helping humans in trouble. She also has old-fashioned taste compared to her looks. She likes "sweet and savory" butterscotch candy and prefers "hot" tea than cold drinks that make her tummy cold.
other_names: ナリ(ガーディアンテイルズ)

The lingerie set consists of a [[black bra|black]] [[criss-cross halter]] [[bra]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] on top, and a pair of [[black panties]] with a [[pelvic curtain]] on the bottom. Both the top and bottom of the lingerie set have [[gold chain|gold]] [[belly chain]]s hanging off of them. It is hosted on the site Yomorio as "Yomorio Sexy Cosplay Lingerie Set Glitter Cat Costume Anime Egyptian Anubis Mummy Lingerie":[https://yomorio.com/products/yomorio-sexy-cosplay-lingerie-set-glitter-cat-costume-anime-egyptian-anubis-mummy-lingerie].

She has [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[drill hair]]/[[twin drills]] with flower-themed [[hairpin]] and [[yellow eyes]]; normally wears a [[school uniform]] with [[black pantyhose]]. Her [[magical girl]] attire includes a [[beret]], a [[white shirt|white blouse]] with [[puffy sleeves]] at the shoulders, a pair of [[detached sleeves]], [[fingerless gloves]], [[pleated skirt]], [[corset]], [[brown thighhighs|brown]] [[vertical-striped thighhighs]], and [[boots]]. title: zeldass_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] started on Twitter when "@decentlymace":[https://twitter.com/decentlymace/status/1224946431733174274] tweeted on February 5th, 2020 that while editing a video about the latest [[Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]] update to 7.0, he discovered that the [[Princess Zelda]] has a frame where you can see the [[silhouette]] of her body under her dress with what appears to be a [[huge ass]]. 

Use this tag for posts that intentionally reference the meme, such as actual "hitbox/hurtbox" models, or depictions of Zelda from either [[the legend of zelda: a link between worlds|A Link Between Worlds]] or [[Super Smash Bros.]] with [[wide hips]] or an otherwise highlighted butt showing through an often partially [[see-through dress]].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Zelda's Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Butt / Zeldass":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/zeldas-super-smash-bros-ultimate-butt-zeldass]
* "Twitter: Original tweet":https://twitter.com/decentlymace/status/1224946431733174274

title: akemi_homura
body:
A character from [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[purple eyes]], and wears a [[hairband]]. When transformed into her [[magical girl|magical]] form, she wears a [[capelet]], a [[pleated skirt]], [[high heels|high heeled]] [[boots]] with [[argyle footwear|argyle]] patterns that cover the entire legs, and sometimes also has a [[shield]] on her lower left arm. She primarily uses mundane weapons such as guns and bombs. 

[spoiler]Her shield acts like a seemingly infinite portable storage space for her weapons, and also allows her to manipulate and travel through time.[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Saitou Chiwa]].

title: kaname_madoka
body:
The protagonist of [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]].

Her [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] is tied into [[short twintails|pigtails]]. She also has [[pink eyes]].

In her daily life, she typically wears the [[Mitakihara school uniform]] paired with [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]] and [[red ribbon|red]] or [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[ribbon]]s [[hair ribbon|in her hair]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], she wears [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|hair]] [[bow]]s, a [[red choker|red]] [[bow choker]], a [[pink gemstone|pink]] [[chest jewel]], a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]] with a [[square neckline]], [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short]] [[white sleeves]], a [[petticoat]], [[buttons]] and a [[heart cutout]] at the [[back cutout|back]], [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], a [[miniskirt|short]] [[white skirt|white]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[bubble skirt]], [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and [[red shoes|red]] [[pumps]] with [[footwear_bow|straps]]. She fights using a [[bow (weapon)|]] and [[arrow (projectile)|]]s.

Her [[voice actor|voice actresses]] are none other than [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese) and [[Christine Marie Cabanos]] (English).

title: midriff
body:
When the [[stomach]] is left partially exposed by clothing.

The midriff is the region of the body between the chest and the waist. Use this tag when the midriff is left bare by clothing too short to cover the stomach, e.g. a [[crop top]] and [[pants]]. The stomach shouldn't be exposed much more than [[navel]]-height, though it can be higher to accommodate {{high_waist_*|high-waist clothing}}.

Don't use this tag as a replacement for the [[stomach]] tag, or when the stomach is fully exposed. This includes when the character is [[nude]], topless, [[bottomless]], wearing only a [[bikini]] or [[underwear]], or when their bottomwear isn't visible. It may be used for "underwear worn as outerwear":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Underwear_as_outerwear], such as [[sports bra]]s, [[camisole]]s, [[tank top]]s worn with panties, etc.

h4. Examples

title: buhanka-chan
body:
Buhanka (more commonly known as Buhanka-chan) is a female character designed as the anthropomorphic representation of the [[UAZ-452]] "Buhanka" vans.

She was designed by an anonymous user, first appearing on 4chan's /ic/ board in February 26th 2022 following the start of the 2022 [[Russo-Ukrainian war]].

She is often depicted alongside other characters from the Russian side, such as [[Kamaz-chan]] and [[Alpha (Alpha 1918)|Alpha 1918]], opposite to characters of the opposing side, such as [[Marichka]].

h4. External links

body:
A life-size [[character doll]] of [[Gardevoir]] that the Pokémon Center began selling on February 6th, 2025. The plush is 5'3 (1.6 meters tall) and immediately gained notoriety for obvious reasons.

A "viral Tweet":https://twitter.com/Rukocos/status/1888776951785197733 of the plush wearing [[black pantyhose]] inspired a {{gardevoir black_pantyhose id:>8838936|minor trend}} of drawing Gardevoir in the same garment.

Only add the tag if the plush is depicted or explicitly referenced in the post. If the post is a redraw of a photo, use [[photo-referenced]] instead. If the post was simply inspired by a photo of the plush, then don't add either tag.

title: natsu_no_yari_naoshi_(summer_redo)
body:
[[Natsu no Yari Naoshi (Summer Redo)|]], also knows as Summer Redo, is an original doujinshi created by [[Keiji Asakawa]] and published under the doujinshi circle [i]Suiren no Yado[/i].

Keito (the main male protagonist) returns to his parent's house in the countryside during summer, where he meets [[Suiren_(summer_redo)|]], the older sister of a neighborhood family and childhood friend. Keito finds out she is engaged, thanks to a jealous [[Aoi_(summer_redo)|]], the youngest sister and also a childhood friend. This starts a series of sexual encounters where he makes both sisters submissive to him, until he must confront their mother, [[Touka_(summer_redo)|]].

title: kakyoin_noriaki
body:
One of the central protagonists of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] [[Stardust Crusaders]].

He has long [[pink hair|pink]] or [[red hair]] and wears a long green [[gakuran]]. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Hierophant Green]].

After being saved from [[Dio Brando]]'s mind control by [[Kujo Jotaro]], he joins the latter's group in their bid to defeat Dio.

He also has an uncanny habit of putting [[cherry|cherries]] in his mouth and making "[[rero rero]]" sounds.

His signature pose is [[Kakyoin Noriaki's pose (jojo)|]] from manga volume 13.

The quote is parodied with [[Umamusume]]'s [[Oguri Cap (umamusume)|]] due to being one of her race-winning quotes.

title: aozaki_aoko
body:
A character from [[TYPE-MOON]] works, first appearing in the unpublished novelization of [[Mahou Tsukai no Yoru]] and cameoing in the prologue and epilogue of [[Tsukihime]]. She was later featured in [[Melty Blood]] and the visual novel adaptation of Mahou Tsukai no Yoru. She appears as a teenager in [[Mahou Tsukai no Yoru]] and as an adult in [[Tsukihime]]. She is nicknamed "Miss Blue" due to the "Ao" in her name being the kanji for blue.

She is the magician of the Fifth Magic, allowing her to perform acts of localized time travel. During Mahou Tsukai no Yoru, she lives with [[Kuonji Alice]] and later [[Shizuki Soujuurou]] as roommates. [[Aozaki Touko]] is her older sister.

She appears in [[Fate/Extra]] as an NPC, and was introduced as a Foreigner-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Kumano Onsen Satsujin Jiken]] event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Koyama Hirokazu]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Mitsuishi Kotono]] ([[Melty Blood]], [[Carnival Phantasm]]), [[Tomatsu Haruka]] ([[Mahou Tsukai no Yoru]], [[Tsukihime (Remake)]], [[Melty Blood: Type Lumina]], [[Fate/Grand Order]]), [[Kimura Akiko]] (Anime)

title: otonokizaka_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]]s worn by the students of Otonokizaka High School in [[Love Live! School Idol Project]].

The main [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue jacket|dark blue]] [[blazer]] over a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]] with alternating blue and light blue stripes, including a red stripe near each fold of the skirt. [[Sonoda Umi]] wears the vest from the summer uniform underneath her blazer while [[Yazawa Nico]] wears her signature [[pink cardigan]] underneath the blazer.

The [[summer uniform]] replaces the blazer with an [[brown sweater vest|brown]] [[sweater vest]], and the [[white shirt]] now has [[short sleeves]]. The vest is sometimes not worn as in the case of [[Hoshizora Rin]]. Meanwhile [[Nishikino Maki]] has a different gray vest for the summer uniform and Yazawa Nico wears her cardigan instead of a vest.

The [[bowtie|bowties]] are [[diagonal-striped bowtie|diagonally striped]] and the colors are class year-coded; first-years are [[blue bowtie|blue]], second-years are [[red bowtie|red]], and third-years are [[green bowtie|green]].

h4. Examples

* !post #4478936: Winter uniform
* !post #7867665: Summer uniform

title: roman_numeral
body:
The ancient Roman way of writing numbers. Likely because of the elegant style, it is still usually recognized and understood by everyday people (at least from 1 to 10), as well as frequently used on clocks.

* 1 = I
* 2 = II
* 3 = III
* 4 = IV (one below 5)
* 5 = V
* 6 = VI (one above 5)
* 7 = VII (two above 5)
* 8 = VIII
* 9 = IX
* 10 = X (can be remembered by how 2 V's form an X; 5*2=10)
* 11 = XI
* 12 = XII
* 50 = L
* 100 = C
* 500 = D
* 1000 = M

h4. See also

* [[dial]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Roman numerals":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_numerals

title: obey_me!_nightbringer
body:
An ikemen romance simulation and mobile rhythm game for iOS and Android produced by NTT Solmare Corp. It is one of many otome games from a dating sim brand called Shall We Date? Nightbringer shares the same cast as [[Obey Me!: One Master To Rule Them All!]], but acts much like a standalone sequel with players not having to have ever played the first game to understand the story of Nightbringer.

The protagonist of this game is the same main character of the original game's storyline. They have been transported to the Devildom of the past just after the demon brothers fell from the Celestial Realm, and the demon realm is a much more dangerous place for humans like the MC than it is in the original game. The characters aside from [[Solomon (Obey Me!)|]] have no recollection of the Main Character or their relationship to them, but they are important to the MC's mission to return to their own time.


h4. In-Game Characters

title: sarashi
body:
A long, winding strip of cloth, usually thick cotton, wrapped tightly around the midriff up to the chest. Historically, [[samurai]] wore them under their [[kimono]] to resist injury.

In anime, [[delinquent]] characters are often seen wearing a [[midriff sarashi]] under their coat or unbuttoned shirt. The wrapping is a visible cue as to their general level of bad-assery.

A [[tomboy]]ish girl may wear a [[chest sarashi]] to bind and/or flatten her breasts, especially if she is trying to pass as male. Alternatively, it may be worn like a [[tube top]] to accentuate the breasts in a very nontraditional way, leaving the [[midriff]] bare. This sarashi style is especially seen on [[kendo]] girls and other fighters. If it's especially revealing then it may become a [[budget sarashi]].

body:
When a person is wrapped in [[bandages]] from head to toe, like a [[mummy]], but their movement isn't restrained by their wrappings.

If a person is wrapped up like a mummy [i]with[/i] their arms or legs bound/restrained by the wrappings, use [[mummification (bound)]] instead.

h4.See also

* [[Mummy costume]]

title: mummification_(bound)
body:
When a person is wrapped with [[bandages]] or similar bindings from head to toe, like a [[mummy]], but their arms or legs are [[bound]] by their wrappings. Generally a [[bondage]] practice.

If a person is wrapped up like a mummy [i]without[/i] their arms or legs bound/restrained, use [[mummification (non bound)]] instead.

h4.External links

* "TV Tropes: Mummy Wrap":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MummyWrap]

title: disarming
body:
Depriving someone of their [[weapon]].  

For the act of disabling a bomb or explosive, instead use [[defusing]].

title: defusing
body:
Disabling a [[bomb]] or [[explosive]], often by means of [[cutting]] a [[wire]] with [[wire cutters]] (such as in the case of an electrically actuated [[time bomb]]), or otherwise literally removing the [[fuse]] of the bomb.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bomb disposal":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bomb_disposal]

title: handfasting_ceremony
body:
A [[wedding]] custom wherein two people's hands are tied together with a ribbon or cord to symbolize the binding of two lives. It derives from an ancient Celtic ritual and is most often included in Wiccan or Pagan ceremonies, but has also become more mainstream and pops up in both religious and secular vows and readings.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Handfasting":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handfasting]
* "Brides.com: Handfasting Wedding Ceremony 101":[https://www.brides.com/story/handfasting-wedding-ceremony-101]

title: relic_(guitar)
body: A custom [[electric guitar]] or [[bass guitar|bass]] that has exterior signs of age, such as peeling paint, scratches, and yellowing.

title: soda_shake_(meme)
body:
A 2012 [[meme]] featuring various characters dancing while shaking and spraying a bottle of [[soda]] at their partner, originally animated while being set to the 2000 Y&Co. remix of the 1998 rock song "[[HOT LIMIT]]" by Japanese musician T.M. Revolutions.

title: disney_tsum-tsum
body: A Japanese franchise featuring collectible plush toys known as [[tsum-tsum]]s based on [[Disney]] characters. The name "Tsum Tsum" comes from the Japanese verb "tsumu," meaning "to stack," reflecting the toys' design for stacking. The franchise spawned a mobile game which would later have a series of crossovers with [[Twisted Wonderland]].

title: nude
body:
Not wearing any clothing on the chest and crotch. Clothing on other body parts, such as [[hat]]s, [[thighhighs]], [[elbow gloves]], or [[jewelry]], may still be worn.

See [[completely nude]] for when a character isn't wearing any clothing at all (except for very minor accessories).

h4. Guidelines

* Clothing on the arms, legs, or head, such as [[elbow gloves]], [[thighhighs]], and [[hat]]s, may still be worn.
* Minor accessories, such has [[jewelry]], [[hair ornament]]s, [[glasses]], [[belt]]s, etc, may still be worn.
* "Naked" outfits - [[naked apron]], [[naked shirt]], [[naked towel]], etc - aren't considered [[nude]]. "Naked" substances - [[naked paint]], [[naked chocolate]], etc - are still considered [[nude]].
* Wearing [[bandaid on anus]], [[bandaids on nipples|nipples]], or [[bandaid on pussy|pussy]], [[maebari]], or [[pasties]] are still considered [[nude]].
* Naked characters covering their nudity ([[nude cover]]) are still considered [[nude]].
* Naked [[mermaid]]s, or other [[monster girl]]s who don't wear clothing from the waist down, are [[nude]], not [[topless female]].
* Don't use [[nude]] with the [[topless female]]/[[topless male]] tags, [[bottomless]], [[no bra]], [[no panties]], [[bare arms]], [[bare back]], [[bare shoulders]], [[midriff]], or other tags for partial nudity. The [[barefoot]] tag is still appropriate to use.

h4. See also

* [[completely nude]]
* [[Tag group:Nudity]]
* [[Tag group:Sexual attire]]

body:
An Assassin-class servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[108-nin no Halloween Rebellion!]] event. She is based on the character of the same name from the Water Margin.

She was originally a Phantom Spirit created for the [[Shinjuku (fate/grand order)|]] singularity, but was rejected in favor of [[Yan Qing (fate)|]]. Her other component is Empusa, a demonic beast from Greek mythology.

title: kriemhild_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The wife (and eventual widow) of [[Siegfried (fate)|]]. She wields his sword [[Balmung (fate)|]] in the name of avenging his death at the hands of Hagen, though it has been transformed into a [[Balmung Kriemhild (fate)|demonic sword]] due to its new wielder.

She appears in [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] as the leader of the Revenge Realm.

Has a [[tongue piercing]].

A character in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] that greatly resembles [[Matou Sakura]], but has longer hair, [[huge breasts]], and wields a giant pair of [[claw (weapon)|talons]]. She can be summoned as an Alter Ego-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: olga_marie_animusphere
body:
Supporting character in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

A member of the prestigious Animusphere family of magi, daughter of the previous Holy Grail War winner [[Marisbury Animusphere]], and the leader of Chaldea. She is monitoring the future and trying to prevent the extinction of humanity in 2016. [spoiler]She dies during the [[Fuyuki (fate/grand order)|]] chapter.[/spoiler]

She appears as [[U-Olga Marie]]'s third ascension as an UnBeast-class servant.

body:
Japanese-based Thai [[Virtual YouTuber]] affiliated with [[REJECT (esports)|]], previously affiliated with [[SCARZ]] and was an independent Youtube-based [[utaite]].

h4. Appearance
She has short white hair with a red streak and a black diamond shaped headband. Her eyes are red and she has small fangs. Her default costume is a black and white dress with red belt and boots. She also carries a giant black and red scythe.

She primarily streams on Twitch and Youtube. On 2 July 2022, she debuted with her Live2D model (post #5817580) designed by [[miwano_rag]]

title: overblot
body:
A worldbuilding and gameplay mechanic in [[Twisted Wonderland]].

When a magician uses too much of their magic and lets negative emotions consolidate into their magic wands, blot accumulates. Too much blot leads to Overblot, and the character in question projects a monstrous phantom that must be calmed down. An overblot phantom will consume a magician's magic until it "runs out", leaving only the phantom behind. Visually and gameplay wise, they function as the "boss forms" of certain characters, normally fought at the end of main story chapters.

This tag can be used for depictions of blot accumulation, canon depictions of overblotted characters, and [[design speculation|fan-made designs]].

title: botan_(kunoichi_botan)
body: The protagonist from the H-rpg by [[enokifu]], [[Kunoichi Botan]]

title: kunoichi_botan
body:
Kunoichi Botan is a H-RPG made in rpgmaker  it was created by Enokifu, the game was published on Dl-site on July/31/2017 and released on Steam on Jan/3/2019.

You take the role of a Kunoichi named Botan who is sent on a mission to rescue her master. Along with her is an ally named Yasuzu who is sent later to ensure the mission continues in case Botan fails

[Synopsis as written on Dl-site]

One day, a young kunoichi by the name of Botan is along with her
comrade disciples assembled by the village chief for a emergency meeting.
It would seem that their master has not returned from a mission and there
is a possibility that she has been captured in the mansion of a brutal fiend
by the name "Demi-Ogre", who has the ability to turn women into sl*ves to pleasure.
Knowing that she is lacking ability, Botan must nonetheless take on the mission
of rescuing her master but... can she really infiltrate and escape from such a mansion?
A mansion that even her master failed to......?

h4. Characters

* [[Botan (Kunoichi Botan)]], * [[Yasuzu (Kunoichi Botan)]],

title: tensei_shitara_slime_datta_ken
body:
That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime (Hepburn: Tensei Shitara Suraimu Datta Ken) also known as TenSura or Slime Isekai is a Japanese fantasy light novel series written by Fuse, and illustrated by Mitz Vah about a salaryman who is murdered and reincarnates in a sword and sorcery world as a slime with unique powers and gathers allies to build his own nation of monsters.

title: vcr_gta
body:
A massive role-playing event for livestreamers organized by [[VAULTROOM]] and [[Crazy Raccoon]], using [[Grand Theft Auto V]] + "FiveM":[https://fivem.net/] as its backdrop.

The server has so far been active for three short periods:
* VCR GTA ran from July 18 to July 29 in 2023.
* VCR GTA 2 ran from December 10 to December 23 in 2023.
* VCR GTA 3 ran from December 2 to December 12 in 2024.

Don't add the [[Grand Theft Auto V]] tag unless recognisable elements of the game appear in the image.

title: felinid
body:
[b]Felinids[/b] are a fictional race of Cat people from [[Warhammer 40k]]. Originally from the planet Carlos McConnell, the Felinids are descendants of human colonists who spliced human DNA with feline DNA in order to survive the plane's harsh environment. Despite their Cat-like features, Felinids are not consider mutants but Abhumans by the Imperium of Man, similar to [[Ogryn]]s and [[Ratling (warhammer 40k)|]]s.

As there is currently no official artwork of Felinids produced by Games Workshop, fans tend to portray the race as either furry cat people or regular humans with [[cat ears]] and [[cat tail]]s.

body:
A classic RPG video game from the [[Warhammer 40k]] franchise based on the tabletop game of the same name.

The player takes the role of a Rogue Trader, an Imperial Noble that's given a grant by the Imperium of Man to explore worlds outside the borders of the Imperium and trade with other Alien races. The player can also recruit different companions from different factions and races.

title: pygmy_hippopotamus_(kemono_friends)
body:
A Friend from Kemono Friends who is descended from a pygmy hippopotamus. She currently only appears in the 10th anniversary image.

It can be seen that this Friend is based on a pygmy hippopotamus despite not having official confirmation. Besides the fact that her general appearance is pygmy hippo-like she also has the hairstyle that replicates the mouth of a hippo, which all real hippo friends have. Her ears and tail match the pygmy hippo, and she has eye highlights which confirms its not an extinct species of hippo. She is currently speculated to be a pygmy hippopotamus by many people.

title: abelard_werserian
body: Abelard Werserian is a former officer of the Navis Imperialis who has served as seneschal of the House von Valancius Rogue Trader dynasty in the Koronus Expanse for solar decades under the leadership of Theodora von Valancius. He is the second-in-command for the player character.

body: The player character of Warhammer 40k: Rogue Trader, heir and head of House Von Valancius, a Rogue Trader dynasty.

title: daewoo_k5
body:
The Daewoo Precision Industries K5 or K5/DP51 series is a [[South Korea]]n 9×19mm semi-automatic [[handgun]], introduced in 1989. It is recoil operated and uses a conventional Browning-type locking system. The K5 is mostly carried by commissioned officers in the South Korean [[military]].

title: mannings
body:
A fictional male character from the [[Orguss 02]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 90s.

[b]Mannings[/b] is a veteran [[military]] officer with [[blonde hair]] and a [[mullet]]. 

He is a cynical and opportunistic womanizer, but he is also quite good-hearted.

His character design is similar to (and was inspired by) [[Roy Focker]] from [[Macross]] and [[Sleggar Law]] from [[Gundam]].

title: john_smith_(the_man_in_the_high_castle)
body: [b][i]Reichsführer[/i] John Smith[/b] (October 14, 1914 - ca. 1965) is the main character of [[The Man in the High Castle]], a former [[united states army|U.S Army]] Captain who joined the [[waffen-ss|SS]]. He is usually portrayed wearing the [[black theme|black]] [[SS uniform]].

title: lady_jaye
body:
A fictional female character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toy line, comic books, cartoon and live action film series. 

[b]Lady Jaye[/b] is a female [[military]] officer who is the G.I. Joe's team covert operations specialist. 

[[Zarana]] is her nemesis.

She debuted as a cartoon character and [[action figure]] in 1984 and was later introduced to the comics in 1985. Lady Jaye is also portrayed by actress "Adrianne Palicki":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adrianne_Palicki in the 2013 live-action film [[G.I. Joe: Retaliation]].

title: erwin_rommel
body:
A [[germany|German]] veteran officer from [[World War I]]. Became the Axis [[Afrika Korps]] Commander-in-chief during [[World War II]]. 

Also known as [b]The Desert Fox[/b], a nickname given to him by the Allies because of his speedy armored attacks and very fast movement tactics that overwhelmed and encircled his enemies during battles that took place in the North African [[desert]].

Nemesis of [[Bernard Montgomery]].

h4. Notable battles

* [[First Battle of El Alamein]]
* [[Second Battle of El Alamein]]
* [[Invasion of Normandy]]

title: nishi_takeichi
body:
[b]Lieutenant Colonel Baron Nishi Takeichi[/b] (July 12, 1902 – c. March 22, 1945) was an [[Imperial Japanese Army]] officer, equestrian show jumper, and Olympic Gold Medalist at the 1932 Los Angeles Olympics. 

During [[World War II]] he was a [[tank]] unit commander at the Battle of [[Iwo Jima]] and was killed in action during the defense of the island.

title: josef_mengele
body:
[b]Josef Rudolf Mengele[/b] (16 March 1911 – 7 February 1979), was a [[germany|German]] [[waffen-ss|SS]] officer and [[doctor|physician]] during [[World War II]]. He performed deadly experiments on prisoners at the [[Auschwitz]] II (Birkenau) [[concentration camp]] with his team of doctors. Well-known under the nickname "Angel of Death" ([i]Todesengel[/i]). 

Died in 1979 during hiding in [[Brazil]]. He had a [[heart attack]] while swimming near a beach.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:People]]

* "Wikipedia: Josef Mengele":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josef_Mengele

title: lieutenant_colonel_william_kilgore
body:
[b]William "Bill" Kilgore[/b] (1921-) was a Lieutenant-Colonel of the [[united states army|US Army]], and a commander of 1st Squadron, 9th Cavalry Regiment during the [[Vietnam War]]. He is a character from the 1979 film [[Apocalypse Now]].

In the film, Kilgore is often portrayed wearing [[aviator glasses|aviator]] [[sunglasses]], a [[campaign hat]], and a [[yellow ascot|yellow]] [[ascot]] inside his [[green shirt]] of the [[military uniform]]. See post #6258560 for reference.

title: kodai_susumu
body:
One of the main characters from the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] [[science fiction|sci-fi]] anime series from the 70s. He also appears in the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] remake series from 2012. 

[b]Kodai Susumu[/b] is a weapons officer onboard the [[yamato (uchuu senkan yamato)|Space Battleship Yamato]]. He is also the younger brother of [[Kodai Mamoru]].

title: khaled_al-asad
body:
[b]Khaled Al-Asad[/b] (Arabic: خالد الأسد) is the secondary antagonist of [[call of duty 4|Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare]], a Middle Eastern [[military]] commander who led the [[OpFor (call of duty)|]].

In the game, his outfit consists of [[aviator glasses|aviator]] [[sunglasses]], a [[red hat|red]] [[beret]], [[keffiyeh]], a [[load bearing vest]] and standard OpFor [[military uniform]]. Also seen wielding a [[Desert Eagle]].

title: guntou
body:
A [[Japan]]ese mass produced [[military]] ceremonial [[sword]] produced for the Imperial Japanese army and navy after the introduction of conscription in 1872. They were distributed to [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] and [[Imperial Japanese Army]] officers as it was required that officers wear a sword.

There were two types of guntou, the kyuu guntou (old military sword) and shin guntou (new military sword).  The kyuu guntou were used from 1875 until 1934.  Their production was not standardized, with different craftsmen producing them.  Many styles closely resembled European and American [[saber (weapon)|sabres]] of the time.  The shin guntou were used from 1935 until 1945.  Most of these were produced in the Toyokawa Naval Arsenal and were based on traditional slung [[tachi (weapon)|]] of the Kamakura Period (1185–1332).

These swords were used during the [[Russo-Japanese War]], [[World War I]], and [[World War II]]. Most notoriously as a last resort weapon used in the [i]banzai[/i] charge tactic.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Guntō":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunt%C5%8D]

title: s-force_rappa_chiyomaru
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]]. Chiyomaru is a [[ninja]] who was once the member of the S-Force, she protects the city from ne'er-do-wells and other criminals. As a result, she tends to clash with [[I:P Masquerena]] from time to time, making them rivals in the S-Force Storyline.

She becomes [[S:P Little Knight]] after defecting from the S-Force Organization due to an as-of-yet undisclosed motive.

Chiyomaru has [[black hair]] with [[blonde hair|yellow highlights]] styled up in a [[ponytail]] and [[green eyes]]. For her outfit, Chiyomaru wears a yellow-and-black colored futuristic ninja attire, with super long heeled boots and the "S-Force" crest on one of her robe sleeves.

title: engineer_boots
body: A type of [[work boots]] easily identified by their distinct stovepipe shape (derived from English [[riding boots]]), lack of laces, and two buckles, one at the top on the outside of the calf and one over the top of the foot at the crease of the ankle.  Originally developed for railroad workers (hence "engineer"), they became popular with motorcyclists and are now heavily identified with biker culture (and similarly rebellious youth cultures, such as punk rock).

title: jojolion
body:
Part 8 of the manga [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], taking place in the [[Steel Ball Run]] universe in present-day Japan.

Shares its setting, the fictional town of Morioh, with Part 4: [[Diamond wa Kudakenai|Diamond is Unbreakable]].

The [[2011 Tohoku earthquake and tsunami]] is an important plot point.

title: al_milgrom
body:
Milgrom is known for his 10-year run as editor of Marvel Fanfare; his long involvement as writer, penciler, and inker on Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man; his four-year tenure as West Coast Avengers penciller; and his long stint as the inker of X-Factor.

Milgrom was also nominated for the Shazam Award for Outstanding New Talent in 1974.

Milgrom came to prominence as a penciler on Captain Marvel from 1975 to 1977. He penciled the Guardians of the Galaxy feature in Marvel Presents, which was written by Steve Gerber and Roger Stern.

title: ed_hannigan
body:
Ed Hannigan has been a writer, artist and editor of comic books for both Marvel Comics and DC Comics. His most notable writing credits include work on The Defenders during the late 1970s and early 1980s. Before leaving Marvel he co-created Cloak and Dagger in the pages of Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man #64. He pencilled the covers on Batman in a lengthy run that spanned the majority of 1983-1985 (with Don Newton providing the interior art). It is also worth noting that he both wrote and illustrated the three issue prestige format series, Skull & Bones for DC Comics in 1992.

Ed Hannigan was also the artist on DC Comic's first ongoing Green Arrow comic book beginning in 1987. This series written by Mike Grell (Jon Sable, Freelance) continued from his limited series, Green Arrow: The Longbow Hunters, wherein Green Arrow sheds his trick-arrows (such as the classic boxing glove arrow), dons a Robin Hood like costume, and lives in a flower shop in Seattle with Dinah Lance, the Black Canary.

[/expand]

A novice Iberian Inquisitor and student of High Inquisitor Dario.
After the 'Stultifera Navis' Incident, she resign from inquisitor and join Rhodes Island as an Inquisition Messenger.

She debuted as NPC in the side story event [i]Under Tides[/i], and became playable in the side story event [i]Stultifera Navis.[/i]

Her motif is based on Leach's storm petrel.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kugimiya Rie]] (Japanese), Liu Wen (Chinese), Lizzie Waterworth (English), and San Moon-young (Korean). Her art designer is [[azling]].

title: volodymyr_zelensky
body:
[[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] politician and former entertainer who has served as the sixth and incumbent president of Ukraine since 2019, most notably during the [[Russo-Ukrainian War|full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine, which has been ongoing since February 2022]]. 

Zelenskyy grew up as a native Russian speaker in Kryvyi Rih, a major city of Dnipropetrovsk Oblast in central Ukraine. He obtained a degree in law from the Kryvyi Rih Institute of Economics, but never practiced law and pursued a career in comedy and entertainment. He created the production company [[Kvartal 95]], which produced films, cartoons, and TV shows including the TV series [[Servant of the People]], in which Zelenskyy played a fictional Ukrainian president. The series aired from 2015 to 2019 and was immensely popular. A political party with the same name as the TV show was created in March 2018 by employees of Kvartal 95. Zelenskyy won the election in 2019 with 73.23 percent of the vote in the second round, defeating [[Petro Poroshenko|Poroshenko]] in the biggest landslide in the history of Ukrainian presidential elections.

Zelenskyy's term was originally scheduled to end in May 2024, but the ongoing Russian invasion and the resulting ongoing martial law prevented the regularly scheduled presidential election from being conducted. He is expected to remain president for the duration of the Russo-Ukrainian War. Due to this extension of his term, Zelenskyy is the second-longest serving president in Ukrainian history, after only Kuchma.
other_names: ウォロディミル・ゼレンスキー

She has [[short hair|short]], [[blonde hair]] with [[aqua_hair|aqua tips]] in a [[two side up]] hairstyle, [[blue eyes]] with [[yellow pupils]] in a [[flower-shaped pupils|four-petal flower shape]] (some artists may draw her pupils [[cross-shaped pupils|cross-]] or [[star-shaped pupils|star-shaped]] instead). She wears two [[grenade hair ornament]]s, an orange [[beret]] and an orange [[bowtie]] with a white, yellow and orange colored, [[double-breasted]] outfit. She has a thin white tail resembling a [[lit fuse]] that gives off sparks at the end.

title: azki_(hololive)
body:
A [[hololive]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Debuted in November 2018 and joined [i]Inonaka Music[/i] alongside [[Hoshimachi Suisei]] in May 2019, before transferring to hololive proper in April 2022 following the dissolution of the label. Current design by [[Scottie (phantom2)|]].

Her name is stylized "AZKi", with only the 'i' in lower case (a convention later repeated with [[hololive English]]'s [[IRyS (hololive)|]], who also debuted as a virtual singer before converting to a regular VTuber.)

She has [[black hair]] (although her recent models have more of a [[brown hair|dark brown]] tone) with the length depending on her outfit with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Prior to her transfer to hololive, she had distinctive pink [[facial mark]]s under her eyes, which were later removed with her transfer and the fourth redesign, and instead replaced by a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]].

Her default hairstyle in her current form is [[very long hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[double-parted bangs]], [[asymmetrical sidelocks|uneven]] [[sidelocks]] and a [[half updo]] tied into a [[half up half down braid]] that turns into a [[short ponytail]], decorated with a [[hairclip]], she also has [[pink hair|pink]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] in addition to the [[colored inner hair]] from her previous model.

title: roboco-san
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]. A soft-spoken, high-performance [[android]]. [[Original|Originally designed]] by [[kuromaru9]] as an [[MMD]] character, but then later became a VTuber following the popularity boom of the medium.

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[brown hair|brown]] [[gradient hair]] with red tips. Being an [[android]], she has [[mechanical arms]] and [[mechanical legs]]. She is extensively modular and can appear with a combination of hairstyles and [[extra ears]], along with glasses and accessories. Her breast size is [[medium breasts|medium]] in her early models, though in later model update has increased it to the [[large breasts|large]] size. By default, she has [[short hair]] and [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]].

Due to her model being originally created for the use in [[mikumikudance|MMD]], her outfit is also extremely modular. She can appear with [[long hair]] in various hairstyles; [[teardrop-framed glasses]], an [[eyepatch]] or [[no eyewear]] at all and [[cat ears]], [[rabbit ears]] or no extra ears.

In February 2023 she got an update to her model that completely redesigned her lower body, adding an extra plate on her stomach giving the impression of a [[covered navel]] and her [[mechanical legs|robot legs]] now extend all the way to her waist and cover to outer side too, giving the impression of skintight pants, she now also has humanoid feet instead of claws.

title: video_crop
body:
Images sourced from video released by an artist. Such examples of source material include [[speedpaint]] or [[making-of|process-steps]] videos released by an artist or a captured video from a live stream. In general this type of image is not preferred unless a suitable version has not been published elsewhere by the artist.

When sourcing an image from a video, please leave a comment including how to access the video if not available from source and a time stamp from where the screenshot is taken. If sourcing from a video service such as YouTube the source can be a link to the video page; when available please using links that start the video exactly where the screenshot is taken.

Due to the nature of videos being almost universally [i]lossy[/i], it's preferred that final images be uploading as PNG (which would be [[lossy-lossless]]).

h4. Video cropping method

h6. Video players

Most common video players include functionality to save a specific video frame, as well as the ability to seek frame-by-frame.
* "MPC-HC":https://mpc-hc.org/ ([code]Alt+I[/code])
* "MPV":https://mpv.io/ ([code]S[/code])
* "VLC":https://www.videolan.org/ ([code]Shift+S[/code])
Browsers also contain such functionality, but it may not work on all sites (like Twitter, YouTube, etc.):
* "Google Chrome":https://www.google.com/chrome/ ([code]Right click video -> "Save video frame as..."[/code])
* [s]"Firefox":https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/ ([code]Right click video -> "Take Snapshot..."[/code])[/s] This appears to save the image as JPEG and as such should [b]NOT[/b] be used.

"yt-dlp":https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp can be used to download the highest quality video from many sites. You can then use the methods above to extract individual frames. For more fine-tuned control, [code]ffmpeg[/code] can be used:

[expand=ffmpeg instructions]
Instructions for Windows are as follows:
* Download the latest build: "FFMPEG Builds":[https://www.gyan.dev/ffmpeg/builds/].
* Move the bin folder to C:\bin.
* Add C:\bin to the system path:
* Right-click "This PC" > "Properties" > "Advanced system settings" > "Environment Variables".
* Under "System Variables", edit Path and add C:\bin.
* Shift+Right Click within the folder containing your video file to open Command Prompt/Powershell.
* Extract frames with this command:
[code]ffmpeg -ss [START_TIME] -t [DURATION] -i [VIDEO_FILE] -r [FRAME_RATE] image-%03d.png[/code]

Format:

[START_TIME]: Start time (e.g., 4:00 for 4 minutes).
[DURATION]: Duration to capture (e.g., 3:00 for 3 minutes).
[FRAME_RATE]: Frames per second (e.g., 1).
Example:
[code]ffmpeg -ss 4:00 -t 3:00 -i video.mp4 -r 1 image-%03d.png[/code]
[/expand]

h4. Examples

* post #2701710 (sourced from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvhExE35b_U&t=550)

h4. See also

* [[end card]]
* [[anime screenshot]]
* [[eyecatch]]

body:

She's a [[squirrel girl]] with both [[squirrel ears]] and a [[squirrel tail|tail]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[green eyes]] and [[medium breasts]]. title: amemiya_nazuna
body:
An [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], originally debuting as part of [[VShojo]]'s Japanese branch. She was teased during [[kson]]'s VShojo introduction video. She later left VShojo at the end of 2023 to continue her creative endeavors by herself.

She is an amnesiac [[angel]] girl, with a [[broken halo|broken]] [[blue halo]], a [[single wing|single]] [[detached wings|detached]] [[angel wings|angel wing]], [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] and has [[heterochromia]], with her left eye being [[pink eyes|pink]] and her right eye being [[blue eyes|blue]].

title: scooby-doo_and_the_ghoul_school
body:
Scooby-Doo and the Ghoul School is a 1988 animated comedy horror made-for-television film produced by Hanna-Barbera for syndication as part of the Hanna-Barbera Superstars 10 series.
The film was followed by Scooby-Doo! and the Reluctant Werewolf in 1988, with the five girl ghouls making their return in the [[OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes]] episode "Monster Party" in 2018.
other_names: スクービーの霊界花嫁学校

title: napoleon_i_in_saint-helena
body:
A painting of [[Napoleon Bonaparte]]'s exile to Saint Helena island, uncredited and dated to the 19th century. This painting was used in the "There Is Nothing We Can Do" [[meme]] that started in 2023.

* !asset #31316124: Napoleon I in Saint-Helena.

h4. External links

* "The painting in the PHOTO12 archive":[https://www.photo12.com/en/image/npl04187_21-100] - This seems to be the most primary source of the image.
* "KnowYourMeme article: Napoleon 'There Is Nothing We Can Do'":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/napoleon-there-is-nothing-we-can-do]

title: akai_haato_(waitress)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Akai Haato]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/akaihaato/status/1810662449517048296].

It's a [[carhop]] [[waitress]] uniform consisting of a [[red choker]], either a [[red shirt|red]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[double-breasted]] [[polka dot shirt]] or a [[layered bikini|layered]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]] with a [[name tag]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[polka dot skirt|polka dot]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[black garter straps]] connected to [[white thighhighs]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]]. She also has an optional [[hamburger hat]]

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, it consists of a pair of [[twintails|twin]] [[twin braids|braids]] tied with [[cherry hair ornament|cherry-shaped]] [[hair bobbles]] and decorated with a [[fork hair ornament|fork]] and [[knife hair ornament|knife]] [[hairclip]] on one side of her head and a ketchup bottle-shaped on the other.

title: omaru_polka_(waitress)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Omaru Polka]].

It's a [[waitress]] costume consisting of a [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[peaked cap]], a [[white shirt]] with [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[vertical-striped sleeves|vertical-striped]] [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[brown vest]] with a [[name tag]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[layered skirt]] [[frilled overskirt|frilled]] [[red overskirt|red]] [[overskirt]], [[mismatched legwear]] consisting of a [[red thighhighs|red]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] with a [[red garter straps|red garter strap]] and a [[white socks|white sock]] [[socks over thighhighs|over it]] on one leg and a [[checkered thighhighs|checkered thighhigh]] on the other and [[red shoes|red]] [[mary janes]]. She also has an [[official alternate color|alternate]] [[black dress|black]] variant of this costume.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume is [[medium hair]] in 2 distinct hairstyles, both of them held by [[hair bow]]s matching the costume main color:

* Thick [[twintails]] (although they are sometimes depicted as fuzzy [[double bun]]s)
* A [[wide ponytail|wide]] [[high ponytail]]

It consists of [[yellow coat]] with reddish-pink trimming over a [[frills|frilled]] [[white nightgown]], with [[mismatched socks]] (one [[green socks|green]] and the other [[yellow socks|yellow]] with a [[heart print]]) and [[white slippers]] modeled after [[Piwwo (pillowdear)|]]. Her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]] with this design is a [[short hair|shoulder-length]] [[wolf cut]] with [[pigtails]] at the bottom, and her [[head wings]] can be swapped out for a pair of [[dog ears]].

title: kama_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class Servant based on the Hindi god of love and one of the [[Matou Sakura|Sakurafaces]], who first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

In-game, Kama is portrayed as an arrogant and sexually provocative goddess, being fully aware that her association with love has led into people associate her with lust as well. However, she is easily flustered when a genuine affection is directed at her.

She has three distinct appearances as she ascends, [[Kama (young) (fate)|a young form]], [[Kama (teenager) (fate)|a teenaged form]], and [[Kama (adult) (fate)|an adult form]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[ReDrop]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Shitaya Noriko]]

title: kama_(beast_iii/l)_(fate)
body:
[[Kama (fate)|]] in her Beast III/L form from the [[Ooku (fate/grand order)|Tokugawa Ooku]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She can be distinguished from her [[Kama (adult) (fate)|Third Ascension]] by her [[slit pupils]], [[spiked halo]], and her [[colored extremities]] being white instead of black. She additionally has [[horns]] and an orange color scheme in her initial form as [b]Kama/Mara[/b].

title: kama_(assassin)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Kama (adult) (fate)|]] as an Assassin-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is in her young adult form here, having long hair and a pink bow tied to the left side of her head like [[Matou Sakura]]. She [[revealing clothes|only wears]] gold shoulder pads with a purple cape attached to them, a gold metallic bra that only covers the sides of her breasts, and a gold metallic bikini bottom. Her arms and legs are charred black and glowing with bright blue flames.

Kama's [[kama (beast iii/l) (fate)|Beast III/L]] form borrows from this Ascension, but her coloration changes and she gains a set of horns depending on which Beast form she's in - either her Kama/Mara form, or her Demon Lord of Lust form.

h4. Appearance
* !post #9005305

title: kama_(adult)_(fate)

title: kama_(assassin)_(second_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Kama (teenager) (fate)|]] as an Assassin-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is in her teenaged form here, with shoulder-length white hair and a pink bow tied on the left side of her head like [[Matou Sakura]]. She wears a purple halterneck top that becomes see-through around the abdomen, gold shoulder pads holding a series of purple strips, tight purple sleeves, a gold metallic bikini bottom, purple thighhighs, and gold high heels.

Note that her halterneck top is the same in her First Ascension. The best way to tell them apart is that the First Ascension outfit has the dark skirt beneath the top's sheer part, whereas the Second Ascension outfit has a gold metallic bikini bottom.

h4. Appearance
* !post #9195814

title: kama_(dream_portrait)_(fate)
body:
[quote]
Celebrating Fate/Grand Order's 7th Anniversary!

Take a trip down memory lane to mark this momentous occasion.

What would things be like now if that fateful encounter had happened differently?
Maybe we'd be looking at Heroic Spirits in completely new outfits.

Let's take this occasion to look back on the day we first met and imagine "what if..."
[/quote]
[[Kama (young) (fate)|]] in her outfit from the [b]Heroic Spirit Dream Portrait[/b] collection of [[Craft Essence (fate)|]]s, commemorating [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s 7th anniversary. Her craft essence is set in the [[Anastasia (Lostbelt) (fate/grand order)|Anastasia]] Lostbelt.

[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[ReDrop]]

title: kama_(exhibition_attire)_(fate)
body:
[quote]祝・「Fate/Grand Order」九周年！！

記念すべき日の祭典であなたを迎えるのは
普段と装いを変えた英霊たち。

今までの冒険を形に留めて、
今日は目いっぱい盛り上がろう。[/quote]
[[Kama (young) (fate)|]] in her outfit from the [b]Heroic Spirit Exhibition Attire[/b] collection of [[Craft Essence (fate)|]]s, commemorating [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s 9th anniversary. Her craft essence is set in the "Chaldea Pavilion":https://fes.fate-go.jp/attraction/.

[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[ReDrop]]

title: johanna_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s depiction of "Pope Joan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Joan, a fictional female [[pope]] who, according to a legend from the 13th century, reigned for two years after disguising herself as a male before being forced to resign after giving birth during a procession. She first appeared as an NPC in the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] chapter before being introduced as a playable Ruler-class servant in the [[Johanna-san to Mikakunin no Ai]] event.

She is a member of the Reinstatement Realm in Traum, and falls in love with [[Constantine XI (fate)|]] during the singularity.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takenashi Eri]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Hioka Natsumi]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #9270134: [[Johanna (First Ascension) (fate)|First Ascension]]

title: caenis_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant of [[Kirschtaria Wodime]] first appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Anastasia (lostbelt) (fate/grand order)|Anastasia]] Lostbelt. She was released as a playable servant after the [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt.

In Greek mythology, Caenis was a woman who was raped by Poseidon. Afterwards, Poseidon granted her a wish; Caenis wished to become an invulnerable warrior. Poseidon granted her wish, turning Caenis into the male Caeneus.

The version appearing in Fate/Grand Order has her original female body, but is often referred to with male pronouns by others in the game. She uses the masculine personal pronoun [b]Ore[/b].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Azusa (hws)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Komatsu Mikako]]

title: rensenware
body:
A novelty "ransomware":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ransomware] created by Kangjun Heo which forces victims to achieve a score of 200 million points in [[Touhou]] [[Undefined Fantastic Object]] on Lunatic difficulty to decrypt their files. The virus is infamous for its main window featuring [[Murasa Minamitsu]].

Heo himself accidentally infected his own computer with the virus and was unable to reach the required score, forcing to create a neutralization tool which he later released on GitHub along with an apology.

title: lan_yan_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]], she is a skilled rattan weaver from Chenyu Vale who is also adept in Qimen Arts. 

Lan Yan is kind, considerate and is as lively as a mountain [[onsen|spring]]. She likes to learn about [[urban legend]]s and folklore in her spare time.

Lan Yan has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]], [[hair intakes]], [[parted bangs]], [[purple eyes]] and [[medium breasts]]. She wears a [[short dress|short]] [[green dress|green]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[side slit]]s, [[long sleeves|long]] [[aqua sleeves|aqua]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[thigh strap]] on her left leg and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]]. She also has [[silver bracelet]]s on each arm, [[multiple rings|multiple]] [[silver ring]]s, a [[silver necklace]], [[silver earrings]], a [[silver hairband]] and a [[bird hair ornament]]. Her [[vision (genshin impact)|]] element is Anemo and she wields a catalyst in battle.

Voiced by Anna Devlin in English, [[Wakayama Shion]] in Japanese and Liu Shisi in Chinese.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8485473: Profile

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Lan Yan":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Lan_Yan

title: jackalman_(thundercats)
body: Character from the [[Thundercats]] series. Often a subject added in [[third-party edit]]s.

title: kashiwada-san
body:
A girl whose expression never changes, and at first glance, it is impossible to tell what she is thinking.
Because of this, she was often misunderstood when she was little. In fact, she has a lot on her mind, and although it doesn't show on her face, she is actually a big laugher, kind to her friends, and has a loyal personality. She doesn't like ghosts. She's not very good at sports and can't swim, but she likes swimming in the sea.
She's not afraid of bugs either. In fact, she likes them. Her family consists of her parents and an older brother who cares about her younger sister.

title: stranger_(omori)
body: The Strangers are a group of phantoms present in HEADSPACE with dark, shadowy forms and glowing white eyes. They represent important people in [[Sunny (omori)|]]'s life, and so Stranger [[Basil (omori)|]] is the most frequently seen in-game.

title: oota-kun
body:
A mischievous boy whose face reveals everything he's thinking. He can't help but be curious about [[Kashiwada-san]]. He swears he'll surprise her, and tries to mess with her, but his attempts usually end in failure.
He's sometimes thought of as a bully, but in fact he's a bit clumsy and cares about his friends.
His grades aren't good, and he always struggles with tests. He has an older sister who loves to tease her younger brother.

title: chijue

title: hobie_brown
body:

Public perception of Hobie Brown has since taken a turn with his appearance in the 2014 Spider-Verse comics depicting him as an alternative [[Spider-Man]], known as [[Spider-Punk]], and Spider-Punk's eventual appearance in 2023's [[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]].

title: the_birth_of_venus
body:
A painting by Sandro Botticelli. It refers to the myth of how [[Aphrodite (mythology)|Venus]] was born out of the waves of the sea. The painting is not portraying the actual birth, but the moment where Venus is transported to shore by a giant shell. 

She is [[completely nude|naked]], [[covering breasts|covering her exposed chest]] with her hand and [[covering crotch|her crotch]] with her hair.

title: the_fallen_angel_(painting)
body:
An 1847 painting by French artist Alexandre Cabanel. 

In the image, a [[wings|winged]] [[Lucifer (Mythology)|]] is shown [[completely nude|fully nude]]. He is depicted [[reclining]] with an arm raised [[covered mouth|over his mouth]], and his [[interlocked fingers|fingers interlocked]]. With tears running down his face, he is seen [[crying]], with a [[furious|raging]] look in his eyes, while [[angel]]s fly in the sky above him.

h4. Painting

title: dom_tropical_test_type
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]YMS-09D Dom Tropical Test Type[/b]

A variant of the [[Prototype Dom]] [[Zeon]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] optimized for extreme environment land combat and [[desert]] warfare. 

Only 30 were ever produced and many were lost during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]] and [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]]. The remaining few became part of [[gundam_unicorn|attacks by Neo Zeonic remnants on Earth]].

title: dom_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

[b]MS-09B Dom[/b]

[[Mobile Suit]] fielded by the Principality of [[Zeon]] during [[mobile_suit_gundam|"The One Year War"]]. 

Designed from scratch as a land combat MS, the Dom differs from its predecessor, the [[Zaku II]], in its revised and much more resistent armor and its added maneuverability courtesy of extra [[vernier thrusters]] in its feet, which allow it to "hover" along the ground. 

The design was later revised for use in [[space]] combat, and entered service as the [[rick_dom| MS-09R Rick Dom.]]

title: aaron_davis
body:
Alter ego of [[Prowler (Marvel)|Prowler]] in the Ultimate [[Marvel]] continuity.

A burglar and career criminal, [[Jefferson Morales|his brother]] and former partner in crime would reform and become a police officer, while Aaron delved deeper into lawlessness. Under orders from Roxxon, he stole tech from Osborn Industries. While doing so, a radioactive spider would crawl into his bag and eventually bite his nephew, [[Miles Morales]].

He became popular with his appearance in 2018's [[Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse]]

h4. External Links

* "Aaron Davis: Marvel Database":https://marvel.fandom.com/wiki/Aaron_Davis_(Earth-1610)

title: shoujo_kitou-chuu
body:
The standard loading message on [[Touhou]] games (as rendered in English) is "Girls do their best now and are preparing. Please watch warmly until it is ready."  It has given rise to a popular "snowclone":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snowclone in Touhou images of "Girls are [i]verb[/i]ing" or "Girl is [i]verb[/i]ing" (and sometimes other substitutions, by the nature of snowclones.)  Use this tag when the image contains this meme in its text, or text derived from this meme.

A more literal translation of the phrase into English would be "girls are [i]praying[/i]".

title: pornography_production
body:
Artistic works that depict the production of [[pornography]]. 

Pornography produced can be [[recording|recorded]] video or audio media, [[livestream|livestreams]], or [[taking picture|photography]].

Typically for the purposes of this tag, there is either a production set visible, or there is intended or current interaction with a shown or implied audience such as through a [[livestream]]. 

A production set often will include [[camera]]s, [[video camera]]s, [[sex toy]]s, [[ring light]]s, [[lubrication|lubricant bottles]], [[tripod]]s, a [[casting couch]] and similar. 

[[Hidden camera]]s, onlookers in a public area filming, personal sextapes, personal [[selfie|nude selfie]]s, [[humiliation]] or [[bullying]] related recordings and similar do not count for this tag. 

The tag additionally requires intention to produce pornography by the recording party, do not include accidental [[nipple slip]]s or exposure that is recorded. Recording or taking pictures without clear sexual framing, even if nude, does not count either, the [[modeling]] tag is a better fit in those cases.

title: anime_coloring
body:
A 2D rendering technique consisting of hard-edge shading, as opposed to any soft-edge coloring techniques, such as those prominent in [[painterly]] styles. 

It is the most common technique in 2D anime production. 

For the similar technique employed in artworks that are [[3D]] - or that intentionally mimic 3D media - see [[cel rendering]].

h4. Examples

* !post #1822620: A [[key frame]] with [[color trace]]s

title: fried_egg
body:
An [[egg]] that has been fried with the yolk left intact. If the [[egg yolk|yolk]] is uncooked then the egg is sunny side up. A traditional [[breakfast]] [[food]] in western countries. 

Can be eaten alone, [[fried egg on toast|on toast]], or even in a [[burger]].

title: regan_macneil
body:
Character from [[The Exorcist]] novel and movies. She is possessed by the Assyrian demon [[Pazuzu]], causing drastic physical and behavioral changes, and she's only freed after an [[exorcism]] is performed on her.

Her disturbing appearance in the first movie was infamously used as a [[jumpscare]] in the 2003 [[scary maze game]], to great effect.

title: astra_yao_(chandelier)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Zenless Zone Zero]]'s [[Astra Yao]], released in version 1.5 alongside her playable debut.

It consists of a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress]] adorned with multiple [[black bow]]s, [[long sleeves|long]] [[white sleeves]] with [[clothing cutout|cutouts]] around her upper arms and a [[cleavage cutout]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]] underneath her dress, [[white bridal gauntlets]] and a [[pearl necklace]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]]. She wears the same [[thigh beads]] and pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[platform heels]] as in her default costume.

* !post #8974627: Profile

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Unbridled's Song (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Rhodochrosite (racehorse)|]]. He became famous as the 8th recipient of the Japanese Triple Crown in 2020. Him and Deep Impact are the only pair of father and son to have both won a Triple Crown (and coincidentally, both were also undefeated).

His trademark is his telephone receiver-shaped star marking, even resembling most emoji renditions (📞) as it is skewed with the top pointing to the upper-left.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], he is associated with [[Daring Tact (Umamusume)|]] and [[Almond Eye (Umamusume)|]] as the third member of the 2020 Japan Cup triple crown trio. In fact, he shines by his absence due to [[fukunaga_yuuichi|his main jockey]] being the implied trainer of Team Ascella, the focus team of the second main story of the game. Fan designs of him as an umamusume almost unanimously portray him as a [[pilot]] due to his name, his association with telephones being secondary. [spoiler]At the very least, a stand-in was used in the cutscene portraying the 2020 Japan Cup.[/spoiler]

h5. Related
* [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|]] - Contemporary and Triple Tiara winner
* [[Panthalassa (racehorse)|]] - Contemporary and stablemate

[/tr]

[[Real Life]] Japanese racehorse. He initially gained notoriety after [[defecating]] mid-race (and winning) the Keisei Hai in 2024. After this victory, he headed on to the [[Satsuki Sho]], only for his jockey [[Yokoyama Norihiro]] to sense that the horse had gone lame at the last minute, having him scratched from the race to keep the lameness from getting worse.

In spite of what happened at the Satsuki Sho, Danon Decile was entered in to the [[Tokyo Yushun|Japanese Derby]] where, despite being the 9th favored to win, managed to beat the heavily favored Satsuki Sho winner [[Justin Milano (racehorse)|]].

h4. See also

* [[Epiphaneia (racehorse)|]] - Sire

title: do_deuce_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]As in "Do a deuce", to tie a game in [[tennis]].[/tn]

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]
[td][[Heart's Cry (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Grandsire:[/td]
[td][[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Dust And Diamonds (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Vindication (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Heart's Cry (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Dust and Diamonds (racehorse)|]].

A bay horse with a star and stripe marking and no leg markings. His first G1 win was at the [[2021]] Asahi Hai Futurity Stakes. He would later become famous as the winner of the [[2022]] Japanese Derby ([[Tokyo Yushun]]), defeating [[Equinox (racehorse)|]], who would finally flourish at the 2022 Autumn Tenno-sho and dominate the field onwards. After a failed bet at l'Arc, a win at the Kyoto Kinen and having his main jockey (the legendary [[Take Yutaka]]) incapacitated during his rematches with Equinox, Do Deuce would finally claim his third G1 win at the [[2023]] [[Arima Kinen]], after Equinox's retirement and with Take Yutaka. He would later claim his fourth G1 at the [[2024]] [[Tenno Sho|Autumn Tenno Sho]], making him the first colt in history to have JRA G1 victories every year from age 2 to age 5. Among the fillies, only [[Mejiro Dober (racehorse)|]], [[Vodka (racehorse)|]] and [[Buena Vista (racehorse)|]] did the same. Not long after, he claimed his fifth G1 at the 2024 [[Japan Cup]], edging out [[Shin Emperor (Racehorse)|]] and [[Durezza (Racehorse)|]] (who finished in dead heat) by a neck. Unfortunately, he was scratched from the 2024 Arima Kinen due to lameness on one of his legs at a poor time and retired to stud without ceremony (Arima Kinen was to be his final race anyway). Interestingly, "he ended up as a neighbor to his rival":[/posts/8660742].

He is also infamous for being a large eater, something often shown when he is personified as a [[Umamusume]] [[horse girl]]. This is more salient due to his jockey comparing him to [[Special Week (racehorse)|]] on how they look like ([[Special Week (umamusume)|]] is also a large eater in Umamusume), even leading people to call him the Supreme Commander of the Reiwa era due to his performances.

[/tr]
[/body]

Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Epiphaneia (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Katies Heart (racehorse)|]].

He is a lighter bay horse with no facial markings and a sock on his left hind leg. He is a somewhat larger than normal horse, weighing between 510 and 520 kg in his prime. He typically ran with a shadow roll.

One of the dominant colts of the 2021 Generation, he is the winner of the 2021 [[Satsuki Sho]]. He had a promising start in his career by winning the 2021 Autumn Tenno Sho and the 2021 [[Arima Kinen]] but he slumped in 2022 and his career ended after being diagnosed with atrial fibrillation in the aftermath of his failed race at the 2023 Kyoto Kinen.

He is famous for winning the 2023 Zen-Nippon Nisai Yushun and being undefeated until the 2024 Kentucky Derby, where he finished third in a photo-finish, behind winner [[Mystik Dan (racehorse)|]] and runner-up [[Sierra Leone (racehorse)|]].

Forever Young's birthday falls on the same day as the release of the [[Umamusume]] game, February 24, 2021. A significant date for his owner, Fujita Susumu, CEO of CyberAgent, [[Cygames]]' parent company.

[/tr]
[/body]

[[Real life|Real-life]] Japanese thoroughbred racehorse, famous for being rated the World's Best Racehorse of 2014. 

Just a Way is famous for his odd friendship with [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]], despite having contrasting personalities. In fact, he apparently has a thing for gray coats in general.

Just a Way has a brown "bay" coat with a cross-shaped white "star" and "stripe" on his face.  He also has a black mane and white "sock" markings on both his hindlegs.

Just a Way is named after the [[Gintama]] [[Justaway]] line of figurines. He was named such by his owner, Yamatoya Akatsuki, who also wrote the script for Episode 32 of [[Gintama]] (where the Justaways first appear in the animated series).

h4. See also
* [[Justaway]]

title: yokoyama_nao
body:
One of the characters of “[[idolmaster million live!|THE IDOLM@STER MILLION LIVE!]]”.
She has [[purple eyes]] and [[brown hair]] in [[drill hair|drill-like]] left [[side ponytail]] and an [[ahoge]].
Her older brother, [[Yokoyama Kei|Kei]], is a professional soccer player.

h4. Profile
* Attribute: Dance (Million Live!) / Princess ([[IDOLMASTER MILLION LIVE! Theater days|Theater Days]])
* Age: 17
* Height: 159cm
* Weight: 46kg
* BWH: 84.0cm-57.0cm-83.0cm
* Birthday: February 12 (Aquarius)
* Blood type: O
* Handedness: Right
* Hobbies: Bathhouse & [[onsen|Hot Springs]] Tour
* Special skill: Not getting tired easily.
* Likes: Chatting with her friends
* Hometown: [[Osaka prefecture]]
* [[VOICE ACTOR|Voice actress]]: [[Watanabe Yui]] (渡部 優衣)
* Theme color: Light blue

h4. Appearance
h5. Million Live!
* !post #1516864: [[Casual|Casual outfit]]

body:
They are characters from [[Idolmaster Million Live!]] and are the older brothers of [[Nagayoshi Subaru]].
* Eldest brother : Masato (将人)
* Second brother : Daiki (大輝)
* Third brother : Hiroto (祐翔)

The appearances and names of all four of them have been revealed, but it is currently unknown which names correspond to which characters.

[/tr]

[td][[Carnegie (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Screen Hero (racehorse)|]] (a son of [[Grass Wonder (Racehorse)|]]) and foaled by [[Mejiro Frances (racehorse)|]] (making him distantly related to [[Mejiro Dober (racehorse)|]]).

Despite a rocky start, he grew to become an accomplished miler, becoming Grass Wonder's greatest legacy with his 6 G1s, including 3 in Hong Kong.

Furthermore, he is even more successful as a sire than his own sire and grandsire, siring 6 G1 winners (so far): 

* [[Pixie Knight (racehorse)|]] (2021 Sprinters Stakes)
* [[Geraldina (Racehorse)|]] (2022 Queen Elizabeth II Cup)
* [[Jack d'Or (Racehorse)|]] (2023 Osaka Hai)
* [[Admire Zoom (racehorse)|]] (2024 Asahi Hai Futurity Stakes)
* [[Mazu (racehorse)|]] (AUS) (2022 Doomben 10000)
* [[Hitotsu (racehorse)|]] (AUS) (2021 Victoria Derby, 2022 Australian Guineas, Australian Derby)

Japanese racehorse. After winning the 2010 [[Takarazuka Kinen]], the horse placed itself in 2nd place of that year's Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe in France.

After standing stud from 2012 to 2023, he retired and is currently pensioned at the "Urakawa Yushun Village AERU":[https://aeru-urakawa.co.jp/horses/] together with [[Suzuka Phoenix (racehorse)|]], [[Oken Bruce Lee (racehorse)|]], and [[Meiner Kitz (racehorse)|]].

Retired Japanese race [[horse]]. He is the highest earning steeplechase race horse in the world, with an astounding 6 wins at the Nakayama Grand Jump, the last of them winning just 13 days after his 11th birthday.

While the horse, or steeplechase racing in general, has not made an appearance in [[Umamusume]], fan artists tend to depict an OC-version of the horse hanging around with [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] and other [[Stay Gold (umamusume)|]]-related characters, as Oju is sired by Stay Gold in RL (and shared temperment issues).

[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[White Narubi (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Silver Shark (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

[[Real life|Real-life]] Japanese thoroughbred racehorse, sired by [[Dancing Cap (racehorse)|]] and inducted into the Japan Racing Association (JRA) Hall of Fame in 1991. Oguri can be considered the most famous racehorse in Japan and was a household name and fan favorite even among people with otherwise zero interest in horse racing.

Oguri has a spotted "dapple grey" coat with visibly darker spots on his rear and flanks. He has a black mane (aging to greyish brown in his later life) and a black tail tipped with brown. There are black "stockings" coloration on both of his hind legs.

The horse was also known under the epithet "The Grey Monster" and had a reputation for having a voracious appetite.

h4. See also

* [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)]] [tn]Anthropomorphized counterpart in the Umamusume franchise[/tn] 
* [[Oguri Cap (Nichijou)]] [tn]Namesake, pet dog[/tn]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Loves Only Me (racehorse)|]]. Contemporary of [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]] and [[Duramente (racehorse)|]], he is the winner of the 2016 Dubai Turf.

He is also the sire of [[Forever Young (racehorse)|]], one of Japan's best dirt horses and international runners and a full elder brother to [[Loves Only You (racehorse)|]].

This tag should be used for depictions of the actual horse or personifications of Real Steel ([i]Umamusume[/i]-style or not) that aren't [[Genjitsu Steel (Umamusume)|]].

Potoooooooo (1773 – November 1800) was an 18th-century thoroughbred racehorse who won over 25 races and placed higher than some of the most prominent racehorses of his time.
He is best known for the unusual spelling of his name, pronounced Potatoes. However, what really places his name in the history of horse racing is the fact that he is the direct paternal ancestors to almost all active racehorses today; with some of his most notable descendants including [[Royal Charger (racehorse)|]], [[Mr. Prospector (racehorse)|]], [[A.P. Indy (racehorse)|]], and [[Northern Dancer (racehorse)|]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Potoooooooo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potoooooooo]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Suave Richard (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Roca (racehorse)|]]. [[Stellenbosch (racehorse)|]] and [[Urban Chic (racehorse)|]] are her first cousins and contemporaries (they share a granddam in [[Land's Edge (racehorse)|]]).

She is famous for winning the 2023 Hopeful Stakes (normally for 2-year-old colts), attempting to challenge the Triple Crown, then winning the 2024 Arima Kinen, being the first 3-year-old filly to win the race in 64 years, edging out [[Shahryar (racehorse)|]] by a nose.

Rhein Kraft was most famous for being the winner of the 2005 Oka Sho and the 2005 NHK Mile Cup. However, she was the only one between her major rivals to die before going into stud, having died of a heart attack in August 2006, three months after her previous race at the Victoria Mile.

He is also infamous for his heavy build, which makes him always looking overweight somehow, granting him nicknames like "Tissue Box" or "Cow-Horse".
