Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Dubai Majesty (racehorse)|]].

One of the dominant colts of the 2021 Generation, he is the winner of the 2021 Japanese Derby ([[Tokyo Yushun]]). He also gained fame by winning the 2022 Dubai Sheema Classic but ended up slumping afterwards. A frequent traveller, he raced in Dubai (3 times), in the United States (twice) and in Great Britain (once).

He retired after the 2024 Arima Kinen, making him the last of his generation's classics to retire, but not before making an effort to win the race starting from the outside gate. He only lost by a nose to [[Regaleira (racehorse)|]].

Real life American-bred Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. As one of the "Golden Generation", the horse went on to win three grand prix races in a row ('98 Arima, '99 Takarazuka, and '99 Arima). After retiring due to a fractured leg, the horse became a successful sire, siring [[Screen Hero (racehorse)|]] (himself a successful sire) and [[Earnestly (racehorse)|]].

He passed away at the age of 30 on August 8th 2025, making him the last great of the Golden Generation to pass away.

Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]] (his effective namesake; "Suzuka" being a [i]kanmei[/i]) and foaled by [[Wakia (racehorse)|]], he was famed for his extreme front-runner running style. He had a poor Classics race year before becoming brilliant the next year, gaining his sole G1 win (The 1998 Takarazuka Kinen, against [[Air Groove (racehorse)|]] and poor [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]]). His career and life ended abruptly at the 1998 Autumn Tenno Sho after a fracture of the left front leg, he was euthanized afterwards.

Silence Suzuka was a chestnut horse with a blaze marking and a sock on the right hind leg. He usually wore a green hood and had his mane braided, decorated with a green and yellow pompom.

He is the model for [[Umamusume]]'s [[Silence Suzuka (umamusume)|]].

He is a dark bay horse with a small, peculiarly-shaped star marking (the "crown") and no leg markings.

As a sire, he currently has a single graded winner with [[Tastiera (racehorse)|]].

body:

[/tr]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Satono Crown (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Partitura (racehorse)|]] (from [[Manhattan Cafe (racehorse)|]]).

Winner of the 2023 [[Tokyo Yushun]] (Japanese Derby) and the 2025 Queen Elizabeth II Cup (the one in Hong Kong). However, both of his major wins were marred by the incidental death of another racer: [[Skilfing (racehorse)|]] at the Derby and, most tragically, [[Liberty Island (racehorse)|]] at the QEII Cup.

He is a bay horse with a distinctive, roughly heart-shaped star marking as well as a pastern on his right hindleg and a sock on his left hind leg.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], the horse is often drawn with his sire's [[Satono Crown (umamusume)|Umamusume counterpart]], especially in reference to the simultaneous ascendancy of Season 3's main cast and their RL progeny.
[spoiler]He is also directly refered to as the "Horse girl with green eyes" in Satono Crown's ending.[/spoiler]
If depicted as a horse girl, Tastiera will almost always have the distinctive "heart-on-a-stem" marking in the same way Satono Crown has her distinctive "crown" marking.

Real Life American-born Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Devil's Bag (racehorse)|]] (Which makes Taiki Shuttle a grandson of [[Halo (racehorse)|]]) and foaled by [[Welsh Muffin (racehorse)|]], he is renowned as the best miler of his generation. 

Taiki Shuttle was a flaxen chestnut (a chestnut with a light-colored mane and tail) with a large star marking on his forehead and a sock on his right hind leg.

Taiki Shuttle died on August 17, 2022 from heart failure caused by old age, he was 28.

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Halwa Sweet (racehorse)|]] (a racemare known for having no tail except for the very base).

She is a contemporary of [[Satono Diamond (racehorse)|]] and initially gained fame as the winner of the 2016 Shuka Sho. She would later win the 2017 Dubai Turf and consistently placed second in her next overseas races (in order, she was defeated by [[Benbatl (racehorse)|]] [2018 Dubai Turf], [[Beauty Generation (racehorse)|]] [2018 HK Mile] and [[Almond Eye (racehorse)|]] [2019 Dubai Turf])

She is the younger sister of [[Verxina (racehorse)|]] and [[Cheval Grand (racehorse)|]].

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Eishin Flash (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Vela Blanca (racehorse)|]]. He is a black horse with a sock on his right hind leg and a faint crescent-shaped marking on his forehead.

He is something of a late bloomer, perhaps due to originally being misplaced on dirt. Upon getting on turf starting in early 2022, he started winning more frequently, easily becoming Eishin Flash's best progeny by winning the Hanshin Daishoten and the Japan Cup in 2022.

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Halwa Sweet (racehorse)|]] (a racemare known for having no tail except for the very base).

She is a contemporary of [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and [[Gentildonna (racehorse)|]] and was the latter's fiercest rival in their classic races as she consistently finished second in the Triple Tiara, even almost winning the Shuka Sho, only losing by a nose. Verxina gained fame by being a double winner of the Victoria Mile.

She is the elder sister of [[Cheval Grand (racehorse)|]] and [[Vivlos (racehorse)|]].

[[Real life]] racehorse. Sired by [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Millefeui Attach (racehorse)|]]. Two time winner of the Tokyo Daishoten, and the winner of the 2023 Dubai World Cup.

A late bloomer due to being misplaced on turf, he very rapidly became Japan's top runner on dirt. He became Japan's highest earning racehorse not only due to his wins at the Tokyo Daishoten and at the Dubai World Cup, but also for his second places at the Saudi Cup and at his second Dubai World Cup, which are some of the races with the richest purses in the world, dethroning [[Equinox (racehorse)|]] from the spot.

Despite being a brilliant runner, he is actually very lazy in training.

title: uberleben_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]German: "Survival"[/tn]

[table]

[/tr]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Roses In May (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Real-life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Meine Theresia (racehorse)|]].  She is well known for being the winner of the 2021 Yushun Himba (The Oaks) as well as her rivalry with [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]], the first true white horse to have won a G1 race and winner of the 2021 Oka Sho (1000 Guineas).

Uberleben is a brown (read: almost black) mare with a small, white diamond-shaped "star" on her forehead and a coronet on her right back leg. In her racing prime, she was almost always seen wearing a blue hood with a white "T" on the forehead section, an item shared by many horses trained by [[Tezuka Takahisa]] (and no, the "T" is not short for "Trainer").

At the time of the 2021 Shuka Sho, the third crown race for fillies, Gallop (a horse racing magazine) played the Sodashi/Uberleben rivalry with a "White vs. Black" frontpage. However, neither won the race. [[Akaitorino Musume (racehorse)|]] (effectively "Red") became the winner of the third crown. [[Akaitorino Musume (racehorse)|]] ("Daughter of the red bird", i.e. of [[Apapane (racehorse)|]]) is also the reason for her strange nickname of "Shiroiare no Musume" ("Daughter of the [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|white thing]]").

She retired in March 2023 due to a bowed tendon and became a broodmare at Big Red Farm alongside her sire. After a failed attempt with [[Benbatl (racehorse)|]] in 2024, her first child was born on February 25th 2025, a dark bay colt with a star-and-snip marking sired by [[Equinox (racehorse)|]]. He is also notable for his T-shaped star marking.

title: anaxa_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. Real name [b]Anaxagoras[/b], a member of the [[Chrysos Heirs (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Uchida Yuuma]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[aqua hair|aqua]]/[[green hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[aqua eyes]], and a [[hand tattoo]]. His outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt]], [[black capelet]], [[white ascot]], [[blue vest]], [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], [[black pants]], and [[blue shoes]].

He is best known for his successes in Hong Kong, both of his G1 victories being won there in 2019. He has since retired to stud at Big Red Farm along with [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]].

title: human_torch
body:
The Human Torch is an alias held by two superheroes appearing in American comic books published by [[Marvel|Marvel comics]], [[Jim Hammond]] and [[Johnny Storm]].

Jim is the original Human Torch and was created by Carl Burgos, first appearing in [i]Marvel Comics[/i] #1 (Oct. 1939). He is an [[android]] created in a lab by Phineas T. Horton, a near- perfect replica of a human being made up of [[cell]]s known as "Horton Cells". These cells transform oxygen into [[energy]] by accumulating heat, causing Jim to burst into [[fire|flames]].

Johnny is the more well known Human Torch and was created by writer [[Stan Lee]] and artist Jack Kirby, first appearing in [i]Fantastic Four[/i] #1 (Nov. 1961). He is a founding member of the [[Fantastic Four]], along with [[Reed Richards]], [[Ben Grimm]] and his older sister [[Sue Storm]], who all gained superhuman abilities after being exposed to cosmic radiation during an unauthorized [[space]] flight.

Both Human Torches are capable of controlling heat energy, generating and [[pyrokinesis|controlling]] [[fire]], [[flying|flight]] and can transform their bodies into a fiery [[plasma]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31287644: [[Jim Hammond]] ([i]Maestro: World War M[/i] #1)
* !asset #31287705: [[Johnny Storm]] ([i]Fantastic Four[/i] Vol. 5 #645)

h4. External links

* "Marvel Database: Human Torch":https://marvel.fandom.com/wiki/Human_Torch
* "Wikipedia: Human Torch (Jim Hammond)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_Torch_(android)
* "Wikipedia: Human Torch (Johnny Storm)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_Torch

title: cesario_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after main character Viola's male alias in [[William Shakespeare]]'s [[Twelfth Night]]. A likely allusion to her sire's "Supreme Commander" nickname by way of [[Julius Caesar]]: this makes her "Little Caesar".[/tn]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Special Week (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Kirov Premiere.

Cesario is the first Japanese horse to win in American soil since Haku Chikara in 1959 and the first Japanese winner of an American G1 at the 2005 American Oaks.

Although she was retired the next year, she was particularly successful as a broodmare, with 3 G1 winners: [[Epiphaneia (racehorse)|]] (who became a successful sire in his own right), [[Leontes (racehorse)|]] and [[Saturnalia (racehorse)|]].

title: vivid_world_(love_live!)
body:
A character song of [[Asaka Karin]] in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki high school idol club]]

The costume worn in the music video consists of a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[tilted headwear|tiltled]] [[Mini hat|mini]] [[Top hat]] with a [[plume]], a [[detached collar]], a [[crop top|cropped]] [[double-breasted]] [[blue tank top]], [[black bridal gauntlets]] with [[wrist cuffs]], [[blue shorts]] with [[black garter straps]] attached to [[black thighhighs|black]]  [[fishnet thighhighs]] and [[blue shoes]] [[strappy heels]].

title: lord_kanaloa_(racehorse)
body:
[tn][i]Kanmei[/i] "Lord" + Kanaloa, sea god in Hawaiian Mythology. His name follows his sire's Hawaiian theming.[/tn]

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]

[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Lady Blossom (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Storm Cat (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]


Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[King Kamehameha (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Lady Blossom (racehorse)|]].

He is Japan's best sprinter of his era, being a double winner of the Sprinters Stakes and, perhaps most importantly, the Hong Kong Sprint, being also Japan's first winner of that race. This is where he obtained his "Dragon King" nickname.

He is also particularly successful in stud, even beyond his sprinter/miler niche, being the sire for [[Almond Eye (racehorse)|]] (Japan's first winner of 9 G1s on turf) and [[Panthalassa (racehorse)|]] (Japan's first winner of overseas G1s on turf and dirt). He even got to score his rival (and crush) [[Curren Chan (racehorse)|]], siring [[Curren Moe (racehorse)|]].

body:

[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Lord Kanaloa (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Fusaichi Pandora (racehorse)|]].

Almond Eye is Japan's most successful racehorse, having won 9 G1 races, breaking the 7 G1 win record held by several other racehorses, including [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]], who retired the year before she became famous and [[Vodka (racehorse)|]] with the fillies; a Triple Tiara; the world record on 2400 m (2:20.6, during the 2018 [[Japan Cup]]). She was also the leader of Japan's greatest earning racehorses, surpassing [[T.M. Opera O (racehorse)|]]'s record, until fellow-Silk Racing owned/[[Christophe Lemaire|Lemaire]] ridden [[Equinox (racehorse)|]] surpassed her at his last race at the 2023 Japan Cup.

Almond Eye is a bay mare with a star-and-snip marking and no leg markings. She usually ran with a black hood with a white shadow roll.

She had 4 foals so far, [[Aaron's Rod (racehorse)|]] (2022, bay colt by [[Epiphaneia (racehorse)|]]), [[Promesa al Mundo (racehorse)|]] (2023, chestnut colt by [[Maurice (racehorse)|]]), "Almond Eye's 2024" (bay filly by [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]]) and "Almond Eye's 2025" (bay colt by [[Equinox (racehorse)|]], notable for being the child of both of Silk Racing's greatest horses and for his lack of markings.)

She is infamous for her prosaic but straightfoward name, leading to jokes where her fellow tiaras have similar names ("Daughter of the [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|white thing]]" for Uberleben, "Daughter of the [[Kurofune (racehorse)|black ship]]" or "Daughter of the [[Buchiko (racehorse)|white mottled one]]" for Sodashi).

Teamed with [[Kitamura Yuuichi (jockey)|]], he is famous for winning the 2024 Hopeful Stakes and the 2025 [[Tokyo Yushun|Japanese Derby]].

In the context of [[Umamusume]], aside from the usual [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|father]]-son pairing, he is heavily associated with [[Chrono Genesis (umamusume)|]] due to [[Chrono Genesis (racehorse)|her RL counterpart]] sharing the same main jockey, trainer, and owner.

title: kurofune_(racehorse)
body:
[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]
[td][[French Deputy (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Grandsire:[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Blue Avenue (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Classic Go Go (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese thoroughbred racehorse. Kurofune, which means "black ship" (as in the one [[Matthew Perry]] sailed in to Japan), was named so by his owner, Makoto Kaneko, in the hopes of the horse becoming the first foreign-bred [[tokyo yushun|Derby]] horse. However, his bid to the classic races in 2001 were snubbed by [[Agnes Tachyon (racehorse)|]] and [[Jungle Pocket (racehorse)|]]. The horse would later be on the short list for the Autumn Tenno Sho, only to not make it in to the roster due to [[Meisho Doto (racehorse)|]] and [[Agnes Digital (racehorse)|]] taking up the two foreign-bred slots of that race.

With the Tenno Sho out of the picture, it was decided that Kurofune would be entered in to the Musashino Stakes held the day before that race. At the Musashino Stakes, Kurofune showed immense aptitude for the dirt race and won handily, securing an entry slot for the Japan Cup Dirt in the process. Later on, Kurofune also crushed his opponents at said race; but sadly his racing career was cut short soon after due to tendonitis, and was retired to stud. As a stallion, he has sired the likes of [[Curren Chan (racehorse)|]] and [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]].

body:

[/tr]

[td][[King Kamehameha (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Real-Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Kurofune (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Buchiko (racehorse)|]]. Sodashi is famous for being the first white horse in the world to be a winner of a G1 race at the 2020 Hanshin Juvenile Fillies. She was also winner of the 2021 Oka Sho and the 2022 Victoria Mile. She is one of the dominant fillies of the 2021 generation, along with [[Uberleben (racehorse)|]] (2021 Oaks) and [[Akaitorino Musume (racehorse)|]] (2021 Shuka Sho).

Sodashi is a white mare featuring an almost uniformly white coat with a few spots of dark skin around her eyes. She ran either with a white or owner-colored hood ("Kaneko" colors: black with a yellow top third and a zig-zag pattern, with blue ears).

She retired on October 1st 2023 due to leg issues, passing the torch to her little sister [[Mama Cocha (racehorse)|]], who had recently won that year's Sprinter Stakes.
On January 30th 2025 (but with the news released 2 weeks later), she gave birth to her first child, a dark bay filly with a peculiarly-shaped facial marking sired by [[Equinox (racehorse)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[Imanami Takatoshi]] - Groom
* [[Gold Ship (Racehorse)|]] - Senpai horse of the [[Sugai Naosuke|Sugai]] stable, with them sharing the same groom
* [[Mama Cocha (Racehorse)|]] - Non-White Full Younger Sister
* [[Meikei Yell (Racehorse)|]] - Contemporary and Non-White Cousin
* [[Hayayakko (Racehorse)|]] - Cousin also notable for his firsts (First white horse with graded wins on both turf and dirt)

title: priscilla_barielle
body:
A character from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]] and the Matriarch of House Barielle and a candidate to become the 42nd King of Lugnica.

She has [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] stylized in a [[low ponytail]] with [[braided bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She usually wears a [[red dress|red]] [[layered dress]] with a [[black rose]] [[dress flower]], [[black bridal gauntlets|black]] [[bridal gauntlets]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]], as well as a [[hair flower]], [[black choker]], [[earrings]], and a [[necklace]]. She also sometimes [[holding fan|holds]] a [[hand fan]].

She is voiced by [[Tamura Yukari]].

h4. External links

* "Re:Zero Wikia: Priscilla Barielle":https://rezero.fandom.com/wiki/Priscilla_Barielle

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Nice Dancer (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Urakawa Miyuki (racehorse)|]].

Nice Nature was Japan's most successful racehorse to not have won any G1 races. ([[Deep Bond (racehorse)|]] surpassed his earnings but only in [i]2023[/i], with all the earnings inflation that entails.  Nice Nature last raced in [i]1996[/i]. [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]] actually surpassed him before his only G1 win in 2001.) His most notable feat is finishing 3rd in three consecutive [[arima kinen|Arima Kinens]], earning him the nickname of "Bronze Collector" and giving him the popularity of an underdog.

His modern day relevance, aside from being the model for [[Umamusume]]'s [[Nice Nature (umamusume)|]], which did gave him renewed popularity, is his tremendous longevity for a thoroughbred horse. Born on April 16 1988, he passed away on May 30 2023. He lived to the ripe old age of 35 years and 44 days, making him JRA's 4th oldest graded winner.

He was a bay horse with no markings. In his racing prime, he often raced with his signature red and green hood emblazoned with his name or his initials.

* [[Baba Hideki]] - Nice Nature's groom

Japanese race [[horse]]. Nicknamed "[b]The Overlord of The End of the Century[/b] ([b]世紀末覇王[/b])" by fans, he is famous for winning all 8 races he ran in in the year 2000. This has made him the all-time leading money-earner in the history of Japanese race horses, with over 1.8 billion yen to his name and only 2 other horses ([[Almond Eye (racehorse)|]] and [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]] has since surpassed him in the 2010s).

h4. See also

* [[T.M. Opera O (Umamusume)|]] - [[Umamusume]] character based on this horse
* [[Wada Ryuji]] - T.M. Opera O's jockey

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Black Tide (racehorse)|]] (a full brother to [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]]) and foaled by [[Sugar Heart (racehorse)|]] (from [[Sakura Bakushin O (racehorse)|]]).

He is a bay horse with a star and stripe marking as well as a pastern on his left back leg. He is known for being unusually big, weighing around 530-540 kg at his prime, being one of the heaviest racehorses of his caliber.

This front-running prodigy with a pedigree that just implies that he won at the genetic lottery is Black Tide's most successful progeny by leagues thanks to his 7 G1 victories.

He is the sire of [[Equinox (racehorse)|]] (All-around genius with 6 consecutive G1 victories), [[Sol Oriens (racehorse)|]] (His first winner of a classic race), [[Wilson Tesoro (racehorse)|]] (His first winner of a dirt G1) and [[Croix du Nord (racehorse)|]] (His first winner of a G1 race for 2-year-olds and his first winner of the Japanese Derby).

He is also the sire of [[Gaia Force (racehorse)|]] (All-terrain meme horse), [[Skilfing (racehorse)|]] (Aoba-sho winner [spoiler]who is more known for dying at the Japanese Derby[/spoiler]) and [[Piko Chan Black (racehorse)|]] (Winner of the 2025 Spring Stakes, a race Kitasan Black and Black Tide previously won.) among others.

[/tr]

Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Duramente (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Mowen (racehorse)|]]. He is a bay horse with a stripe slanted over the right side of his face and pasterns on his right legs and his back left leg. He is [[Melody Lane (racehorse)|]]'s normal-sized younger brother and is famed for his front-runner running style even as a Stayer (long-distance runner).

One of the dominant colts of the 2021 generation, he is the winner of the 2021 Kikuka Sho, becoming the first to win this race as a front-runner since [[Seiun Sky (racehorse)|]] in 1998. He would later win the 2022 Spring Tenno Sho and the 2022 Takarazuka Kinen but, after a failed bet at l'Arc, he would eventually face [[Equinox (racehorse)|]]'s ascendence, and then injury at the 2023 Spring Tenno Sho. He would return for the Autumn season but never at his previous peak. He retired after his last race at the 2023 Arima Kinen, where he finished 3rd.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], he, or a [[horse girl]] version of himself, is often depicted with his RL sire [[Duramente (umamusume)|]] or with fellow Erimo native [[Daring Tact (umamusume)|]] (especially when it involves fighting [[bear]]s). Alternatively, Titleholder (horse or horse girl) is often depicted with Melody Lane or with his contemporaries, [[Efforia (racehorse)|]] and [[Shahryar (racehorse)|]].

title: equinox_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after the time of the year when day and night are the same length. Alludes to the contrast between the names of his sire and dam (Black & White).[/tn]

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]
[td][[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Grandsire:[/td]
[td][[Black Tide (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Chateau Blanche (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[King Halo (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Chateau Blanche (racehorse)|]] (by [[King Halo (racehorse)|]]).

A brown horse with a stocking on his right back leg and a wide blaze marking.

He gained fame, initially, for coming in second place for both the Satsuki-sho (to [[Geoglyph (racehorse)|]]) and the [[Tokyo Yushun]] (to [[Do Deuce (racehorse)|]]), before turning to the 2022 Autumn Tenno-sho, where he covered and overtook runner [[Panthalassa (racehorse)|]]'s 15 to 20 lengths lead, earning him his first GI title. Equinox then went on to win the 2022 [[Arima Kinen]] as well as the 2023 Dubai Sheema Classic in his overseas stint. Afterwards, he won the 2023 [[Takarazuka Kinen]] by a neck, almost losing to [[Through Seven Seas (racehorse)|]] due to a fumble. He finished his streak by shattering the race record (and the world record on 2000m turf) at the 2023 Autumn Tenno-sho and dominating a very stacked 2023 Japan Cup. He was retired to stud afterwards, citing he would not have been ready in time for the Arima Kinen.

He is Kitasan Black's first G1-winning progeny and proved himself to be not only one of the best racehorses of his generation but also becoming the best rated racehorse in the world. His victory at the 2023 Japan Cup made him Japan's greatest earning racehorse (a reign that didn't last long due to [[Ushba Tesoro (racehorse)|]]'s repeated appearances in the Dubai World Cup and the Saudi Cup)  and, had he continued, he would have been well on his way to become Japan's first 7 G1 winner on turf with [b]no[/b] classic race wins.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], as the son of [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|]], most fan designs portray him in some form of [[japanese clothes|Japanese-style outfit]], often with a Sun & Moon motif with a red and blue color scheme that references the [[racing colors]] of Silk Racing, Equinox's owner. He is also depicted together with [[King Halo (umamusume)|]] and/or [[Sakura Bakushin O (umamusume)|]] on some occasions.

h4. See also

* [[Christophe Lemaire]] - Equinox's [[jockey]]

She is the Triple Tiara and Japan Cup winner of 2012, as well as the rival of [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]], [[Just A Way (racehorse)|]], and [[Verxina (racehorse)|]] (also of [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]], who also happens to be owned by Sunday Racing). After retiring from racing, she became a successful broodmare, most notably foaling [[Geraldina (racehorse)|]], who won the Queen Elizabeth II Cup in 2022.

body:
[tn](Name means "Goldsmith" in French.)[/tn]

[/tr]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Stay Gold (Racehorse)|]] out of [[Oriental Art (Racehorse)|]].

Orfevre is a chestnut stallion with a prominent white blaze down his face. He also has a white "sock" marking on his left hindleg.

Orfevre is best known for winning the 2011 Japanese Triple Crown and being voted Japanese Horse of the Year for the same year. He  accumulated a total of 6 G1 victories. He also placed twice in the prestigious Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe, being narrowly defeated twice on successive attempts in 2012 and 2013.  

Orfevre has a reputation as a talented but highly temperamental horse, being particularly infamous for savagely bucking off his jockey right after the moment of achieving the Triple Crown, earning him the nickname of "The Golden Tyrant".

h4. See also
* [[Orfevre (Umamusume)]] [tn][[Horse girl|Anthropomorphized]] fictional counterpart in [[Umamusume]].[/tn]

Real-life Japanese thoroughbred racehorse, famous for winning the the Japanese Triple Crown and being the first undefeated Japanese Triple Crown. He was inducted into the Japan Racing Association (JRA) Hall of Fame in 1987.

Rudolf has a predominantly bay coat with a prominent white crescent-shaped facial mark near the top of his head. Three of his legs are completely black starting from the knee down; his left hindleg is black from the upper knee but shifts color to white after the cannon (i.e. the metatarsals. May look like the lower knee or ankle for people unfamiliar with horse anatomy).

[tn]Or, in equivalent humanoid character terms, he has black 'thighhighs' (i.e. "stockings", to use the horse fur pattern terminology) on all four of his legs, plus an additional white ankle "sock" on 'top' for his left hindleg.[/tn]

h4. See also

** His anthropomorphized, alternate-universe counterpart in [[Umamusume]].

title: hololive_grand_theft_auto
body:
A massive [[hololive]] roleplaying event organized by [[Sakura Miko]] and [[Hoshimachi Suisei]], using [[Grand Theft Auto V]] + "FiveM":[https://fivem.net/] as its backdrop.  It ran for one week starting September 16, 2024, and involved almost everyone from all established Hololive branches.  Each member was given a "role", but aside from that emergent storytelling was allowed to unfold.  As a result, it has spawned many MANY memorable moments and setpieces, as shown in the art posted.

h4. Cast
h5. Ho-Los Santos Police Department
[b]Chief[/b]: [[Oozora Subaru]]
[b]Deputy Chief[/b]: [[Shishiro Botan]]

h6. Members

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Kartica (racehorse)|]], he was the last of Deep Impact's progeny to win a classic race in Japan, being the winner of the 2022 Kikuka Sho.

He was a bay horse with a stripe and snip as well as socks on every leg.

He turned out to be a typical Deep Impact early bloomer as he went into a slump after the Kikuka Sho. Whether he could have broken out of his slump became a moot point after he unexpectedly died of heat stroke on August 8th 2023.

title: sunday_silence_(racehorse)
body:
[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]
[td][[Halo (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Grandsire:[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Wishing Well (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Understanding (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Sunday Silence (1986-2002) is a successful American racehorse and winner of two of the American Triple Crown in 1989. The horse, however, is better known as the leading sire in Japan for 13 years, including 5 years [i]posthumously[/i]. Many of his numerous offspring and descendants became successful racehorses themselves and several became popular sires and broodmares in their own right, especially [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] (2002 - 2019), one of his most successful offspring and successor as a long-streaking leading sire (11 years and counting). His influence is so pervasive to the point that nowadays, almost all racehorses in Japan racing at any given level and aren't foreign-bred are direct descendants of Sunday Silence.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], he is the RL sire or ancestor of a significant portion of the horse girls, especially the youngest in RL. Whenever he is portrayed as a horse girl, he usually takes the form of a [[look-alike]] of [[Manhattan Cafe (umamusume)|]] (or being just portrayed [i]by[/i] Manhattan Cafe) due to the original horse being said to be the spitting image of his sire, to the point of being able to stand-in as Sunday Silence in a TV movie about him and his Japanese owner, [[Yoshida Zenya]].

title: grand_theft_auto_v
body:
Open-world action game developed and published by Rockstar Games. The fifth game in the [[Grand Theft Auto]] series. Originally released in 2013 for [[Xbox 360]] and [[Playstation 3]], 2014 for [[Xbox One]] and [[Playstation 4]], 2015 for [[Microsoft]] [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], and 2022 for [[Xbox Series X]]/S and [[Playstation 5]]. 
Includes GTA Online, a multiplayer open-world action game set in Los Santos before and after the events of GTA V's Story Mode, for playing with [[online character (gta v)|other players]].

title: lily_servant
body:
Theoretical fan-designed [[light persona]] and often [[aged down]] version of a character from the [[fate (series)|Fate series]]. Although the tag is [i]Lily Servant[/i], this can apply to Masters and other human characters as well. Lily Servants are depicted as more benevolent versions of their original selves, and tend to wear white clothing.

The opposite of this is [[Alter Servant]].

Not to be used for official Lily Servants or official aged-down variants of servants, which include:

title: hewdraw
body:
A recurring boss in the [[Kid Icarus]] series. A part of the Underwold Army, it is a large, snake-like [[dragon]] inspired by the [[hydra]]. 
It undergoes a drasitc re-design in [[Kid Icarus Uprising]] as it now consists a single body shared by three heads, each with its own personality. Each of these heads are separated from their body and fought individually in Chapter 3 of the game.

body: A sekirei from the manga [[Sekirei]]. She possesses the ability to grow plants rapidly, and has a "twin brother" whose ability is to cause plants to wither. Rather odd among female sekirei for [[flat chest|lacking big breasts]].

title: tezcatlipoca_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Nahui Mictlan (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. Tezcatlipoca is a spider and jaguar deity in Aztec mythology, and he is fiercely at odds with [[Quetzalcoatl (fate)|]] due to their differing beliefs on human sacrifice. He first briefly appeared in a disguised form in the [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt before being released as a playable Assassin-class servant. [spoiler]He took up the mantle of Grand Assassin after [[King Hassan (fate)|]] rescinded his title in the [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity, and would ordinarily qualify for Grand Berserker.[/spoiler]

Tezcatlipoca himself has four different aspects that make up the entire Divine Spirit, with this tag referring to the Black Tezcatlipoca. His other aspects are Red Tezcatlipoca, [[Tezcatlipoca (Young) (fate)|Blue Tezcatlipoca]], and [[Quetzalcoatl (fate)|White Tezcatlipoca]].

His name is Nahuatl for "Smoking Mirror". He appears in Fate/Grand Order as a pseudo-servant possessing a human body he created himself. His third ascension is locked until players complete Nahui Mictlan.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Sho-u Tajima]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Mikami Satoshi]]

title: yajima_gakuro
body:
The protagonist of [[Nue no Onmyouji]].

He has [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[green hair]] or [[blonde hair]], depending on [[Kawae Kouta]]'s inconsistent coloring, along with [[black streaks]] on his left side of hair, a [[birthmark]] under his left eye and a pair of [[brown eyes]]. 

He is usually seen wearing the [[school uniform]], which consists of a [[short sleeves]] [[white shirt]] and [[black pants]]. During battle, his left eye transforms into a [[flaming eye]] which covered his hair streaks and birthmarks, while his hair remains in the same style. But after receiving an upgrade, his hairstyle changes to [[hair slicked back|slicked back]].

title: mimori_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Vice-president of the Inner Discipline Club. Her full name is Mizuha Mimori.

She has [[blue eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] tied into a [[bun with braided base|braided]] [[single side bun]] held with a [[hair ribbon]] and a [[tassel hair ornament]] tied into a [[flower knot]], with [[sidelocks]] and [[swept bangs|swept]] [[double-parted bangs]].

Her regular outfit is a miko-themed [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[serafuku]] with a [[red sailor collar]], a [[chihaya (clothing)|]] (although it's often portrayed  as a simple [[cape]]), a red [[obi]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]]-length [[hakama short skirt]] with a [[waist bow]], a [[black pantyhose]], [[white socks|white]], [[tabi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[okobo]].

Her personal weapon is a Sugiura [[handgun]].

Voiced by: [[Tanaka Rie]]
Original artist: [[tokki]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #7238956: [[Mimori (Swimsuit) (blue archive)|Swimsuit]]

title: leto_(arknights)
body:
[i]Leto of the Ursus Student Self-Government Group, charging in with a mighty "URAAAH!"[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Rosalind Tatyanovna Larina

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 30[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]167 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1.5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Member of the Ursus Student Self-Governing Group and second strongest after [[Zima (arknights)|]].

She is very direct, open and hardships don't seem to affect her much. She likes to study languages and travel the world. She enjoys getting honey-drunk.

[spoiler]Daughter of [[Arctosz Paleroche (arknights)|]] and [[Tatyana Yevgenyevna Larina (arknights)|]]. Her grandfather sent her and her mother away from Kjerag in fear of retaliation from the other clans. As such, she lived most of her life without a dad.

Leto is the only character that didn't develop PTSD after the events of [i]Children of Ursus[/i], in fact she's shown to feel great enjoyment when facing mortal danger, such as [[Faust (arknights)|]].[/spoiler]

Her motif is based on the Asian black bear or the grizzly bear.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Asai Ayaka]] (Japanese), Chen Yu (Chinese), Christina Sherman (English), Lee Dal-lae (Korean), and Lina Ivanovna (Russian). Her art designer is [[Skade]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #8878806: Default
* !post #8878807: Elite II
* !post #3965127: Weaponless

title: oekaki
body:
A drawing made with very simple tools, usually imageboard/bbs-embedded drawing software, with [[jaggy lines|very sharp and thin lines]].

Oekaki (お絵描き) is Japanese for "scribble" or "doodle". On the Internet, an Oekaki is a message board system that revolves around computer art created by a local art program. Oekaki artists often post their art to other websites, such as personal pages or free gallery websites, in addition to the original board.

A specific form is known as "binary art", the use of limited colors, no color blending, no antialiasing, and not low resolution, distinguishing it both from [[pixel art]] and general digital art.

h4. See also

* [[stickam]]
* [[tegaki]]

title: cynthia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Cynthia[/b], known as [b]Shirona[/b] (シロナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon dppt|Pokémon Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This Champion of Sinnoh is an archeologist who researches the history and mythology of Pokémon. Her deep love for Pokémon sent her on an adventure when she was young [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Garchomp]].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[very long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] which [[hair over one eye|covers one eye]]. She wears [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], a [[fur collar]], a [[black shirt|shirt]] under a [[black coat|black]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[fur-trimmed coat]] with a [[v-neck]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels|heels]].

body:

title: pokemon_swsh
body:
[i]Pokemon Sword and Pokemon Shield[/i] are the first games in the eighth generation of the [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] series, released for the [[Nintendo Switch]] in November 2019. The games take place in the Galar Region, based on England.

[b]Use [[Pokemon SwSh]] only for human characters, not for Generation VIII Pokemon by themselves[/b]. This includes personifications, dolls, etc. For example, post #3429705 is just a Scorbunny, so it shouldn't be tagged [[Pokemon SwSh]].

See [[help:pokemon tags|Help:Pokémon tags]] for more tagging guidelines.

title: rhodes_island_hr_head_(arknights)
body:
The head of Rhodes Island's Human Resource Department, a remaining member of its predecessor Babel. She is a Djall Sarkaz and [[Nymph (arknights)|]]'s elder sister.

Little is known about her except the notations she wrote in other operators' files and a few mentions of her in story and other operators' files. Her name is intentionally obscured by spells, signatures and mentions of her name are all written as ■■■. Players use the name 三黑框 (three black blocks) to refer to her.

title: amphicar
body: An Amphicar is an amphibious automobile, designed to drive on both land and water. It was manufactured in Germany from 1961 to 1968, with the Model 770 being the most well-known version. The "770" designation refers to its ability to achieve speeds of 7 knots in the water and 70 mph on land.

title: gegege_no_kitarou
body:
Original title: 墓場鬼太郎([i]Hakaba (no) Kitarō[/i]), lit. [i] Kitarou (of the) Graveyard[/i]

A supernatural/horror manga by [[Mizuki Shigeru]], also known as [i]Spooky Kitaro[/i] in some regions, serialized in [i]Weekly Shōnen Magazine[/i] from 1959-1969.

Numerous anime and live action adaption have been made since 1968 but on January 2008 the original comic was adapted into an anime by Toei Animation.

title: renminbi
body:
The renminbi (lit. 'People's Currency'; [[yen sign|symbol: ¥]]; ISO code: CNY; abbreviation: RMB) is the official currency of the [[China|People's Republic of China]].

The yuan (Chinese: 元 or simplified Chinese: 圆; traditional Chinese: 圓; pinyin: yuán) is the basic unit of the renminbi, but the word is also used to refer to the Chinese currency generally, especially in international contexts. One yuan is divided into 10 jiao (Chinese: 角; pinyin: jiǎo), and the jiao is further subdivided into 10 fen (Chinese: 分; pinyin: fēn).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Renminbi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renminbi]
* "Wikipedia: Yuan (currency)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuan_(currency)]

title: etherlite
body:
A [b]Mystic Code[/b] wielded by [[Sion Eltnam Atlasia]].

While looking similar to [[string]],it consists of an artificial Nervous system with the shape of a nano-scale filament one micron thick that cannot be seen with the naked eye.

Although it's used like a whip by Sion, it is actually designed to attach to the opponent's skin, integrate with their central nervous system, and read their thoughts and memories.

[spoiler]While travelling to Penacony after being invited by the Family, he would meet his end at the hands of [[Acheron (honkai: star rail)|]]. [/spoiler]

title: karasawa_(weapon)
body: An [[energy gun]] from the [[Armored Core]] series. Typically one of the most powerful weapons in the games it appears in. Generally its shape bears a strong resemblance to the [[positron cannon]] from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], which predates the first Armored Core game by 2 years. Its name varies depending on the generation: * [[Armored Core]]: [b]WG-1-KARASAWA[/b] * [[Armored Core 2]]: [b]KARASAWA-MK2[/b] * [[Armored Core 3]]: [b]MWG-KARASAWA[/b] * [[Armored Core: Nexus]]: [b]WH04HL-KRSW[/b] * [[Armored Core 4]]: [b]HLR01-CANOPUS[/b] * [[Armored Core V]]: [b]LR-81 Karasawa[/b] / [b]LR-81M KRSW[/b] (lightweight variant) * [[Armored Core: Verdict Day]]: [b]Au-L-K29[/b] / [b]Au-L-K37[/b] / [b]X00 KARASAWA[/b] (direct successor to LR-81) * [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]: [b]44-142 KRSV[/b] ** It transforms into the Karasawa shape by charging energy. Nicknamed カラサヴァ (Karasava) due to its name. h4. Notable users KARASAWA-MK2 * [[Leos Klein]]'s AC [b]MWG-KARASAWA[/b] * [[Crest CR-C98E2 Assault Type]] * 13's [[Mavors]] (in [[Armored Core: Brave New World]]) WH04HL-KRSW * [[Jack-O]]'s [[Foxeye (Armored Core)|]] Au-L-K29 * [[Magnolia Curtis (Armored Core)|]]'s [[R.I.P.3/M]] 44-142 KRSV * [[Mind Beta (Armored Core VI)|Mind Beta]] * [[Kate Markson]]'s Transcriber * [[G5 Iguazu (Armored Core Vi)|]]'s [[Mind Gamma (Armored Core VI)|]] h4. See also * [[Moonlight (armored core)|]] - Another line of recurring weapons in AC series.

title: cecelia_(arknights)
body: An NPC from Arknights. A young Sankta girl with [[long hair|long]], [[white hair]]. During the events of "Guide Ahead", she becomes a person of interest by various factions who either want to rescue her or use her for their own reasons. It is later revealed that Cecelia is special as [spoilers]she is a Sankta child of a Sankta mother and Sarkaz father, something considered impossible since Sankta children are only born between two Sankta parents while children between a Sankta and a non-Sankta always results with the child being non-Sankta.[/spoilers]
other_names: セシリア(アークナイツ)

title: baldr_(fire_emblem_heroes)
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]], introduced in Book IX.

A goddess from Asgardr, Baldr is an arrogant, haughty goddess sent by her master (and father) [[Alfathor (Fire Emblem)|Alfaðör]] to apprehend [[Alfonse (Fire Emblem)|]] for accused crimes against the gods. [[Hodr (Fire Emblem)|Höðr]] and [[Vali (Fire Emblem)|]] are her younger sisters.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8523497
* !post #9797316: [[Baldr (Rays Of Judgment) (Fire Emblem Heroes)|Rays of Judgment]] 

Not to be confused with [[Baldr (Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War)|the crusader]] from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]].
other_names: バルドル(ファイアーエムブレム)

title: kazama_iroha
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "[[holoX]]". A [[samurai]] from a distant land who joined the holoX secret organization and served as a hitman and bodyguard. Designed by [[Umibouzu (niito)|]].

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium]]/[[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]], although more often than not fanart exaggerates her bust size, giving her [[medium breasts]] (at the very least).

Her default hairstyle with her default outfit is a [[ponytail]] held with a [[multicolored bow|multicolored]] [[hair bow]], an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] held with a [[black hairband]].

title: hakui_koyori
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "[[holoX]]". A [[wolf girl|coyote girl]] and the head researcher and engineer of the holoX secret organization. Designed by [[momoko (momopoco)|Momoco Haru]].

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[pink hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[wolf ears|coyote ears]], [[pink tail|pink]] [[wolf tail|tail]], and [[large breasts]].
Her regular hairstyle consists of a [[crown braid]] that turns into [[double bun|double]] [[braided bun]]s with [[sidelocks]], [[wispy bangs|choppy]] [[double-parted bangs]] and [[antenna hair]], she also has a pair of [[hexagon hair ornament]]s styled after a chemical diagram.

title: snowman
body:
A handmade sculpture made out of compacted [[snow]]. Usually it consists of two or three large snowballs stacked on top of each other, then adding decorations like a [[hat]] or [[bucket]], [[coal]] or [[rock]] for the eyes and buttons, a [[carrot]] for the nose, a [[scarf]], and twigs for arms.

For non-snowman-shaped snow art, see [[snow sculpture]].

h4. Examples

* !post #1353860
* !post #1971811

h4. See also

* [[snow rabbit]]

title: malice_(sue_storm)
body:
Malice is the villainous [[dark persona]] of [[Sue Storm]], awakened in her by Psycho-Man's Hate-Monger, who amplifies her negative emotions, causing her to attack her fellow [[Fantastic Four]] members. Malice retains Susan's abilities, but uses them much more agressively.

Though she first appeared in [i]Fantastic Four[/i] #280 (April 1985), she gained increased popularity in 2025, when Sue Storm was added to [[Marvel Rivals]] with her Malice persona being included as a [[official alternate costume|playable skin]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31253936: [i]Fantastic Four[/i] Vol. 1 #384
* !asset #24738918: [[Marvel Rivals]]

h4. External links

* "Marvel Wiki: Malice":https://marvel.fandom.com/wiki/Susan_Storm_(Malice)_(Earth-616)

h4#intro. Intro

This is a list of all characters that appear in [[Gust]]'s [[Atelier (series)]] of Japanese role-playing games. The games are sorted by chronological release, then the characters are sorted alphabetically. Due to many characters appearing in multiple entries, they will only be listed in the game they debuted in.

title: massena_(azur_lane)
body:
A representation of a [b]1913[/b] battlecruiser proposal for the French navy that suggested a ship armed with 2 quad 340mm guns, (same turret type used on Normandie and [[Lyon (Azur Lane)|]] class), in A-X configuration later reused on [[Gascogne (Azur Lane)|]]. Due to the outbreak of WW1 no serious design work was ever conducted. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9771115: (Base art)  
* !post #9774675: [[massena (sweetly intoxicating spring) (azur lane)|Sweetly Intoxicating Spring]] (naked towel)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: French [i]battlecruiser proposals[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_battlecruiser_proposals#Project_%22A%22_characteristics]

title: cropped_head
body:
A character that has been drawn so that only their head, neck, and potentially collarbone are visible. Do not use if the character is merely [[out of frame]]; the head should be visibly disconnected and floating on its own. 

Not to be confused with [[chibi]] or [[chibi inset]].

title: squirrel_fish
body:
A well-known [[chinese food|Chinese dish]] in Jiangsu cuisine, originally from Suzhou. It is prepared by deboning and carving a mandarin [[fish (food)|]] into an ornamental shape similar to a squirrel, and then deep-frying it in batter before dousing it in sweet and sour [[sauce]].

It is adapted into [[Genshin Impact]] [[squirrel fish (genshin impact)|with the same name]]. 

h4. See also 
* [[fried fish]]
* [[tag group:food tags]]

title: baba_konomi
body:
One of the idols of “[[idolmaster million live!|THE IDOLM@STER MILLION LIVE!]]”.

Her features are [[aqua eyes]] and [[braid|braided]] [[brown hair]]. Distinguishable from other brown-haired characters by having a [[cowlick]] on each side of her hair.

Because she is [[petite]], she is at times mistaken for a child. However, she is mature and dependable, and actually the oldest of the Million Live group.
Konomi has a younger sister [[baba karin (idolmaster)|Karin]], but Karin has a more mature physique than Konomi.

h4. Profile

* Age: 24
* Height: [b]143 cm (4'8") [/b]
* Weight: 37 kg(BMI: 18.09)
* BWH: 75.0 cm- 55.0 cm- 79.0 cm
* Birthday: June 12(Gemini)
* Blood type: A
* Hometown: [[Yamaguchi prefecture|Yamaguchi]]
* Handedness: Right
* Hobbies: Appreciation North American drama
* Special skill: [[Mahjong]]
* Favorite drinks: [[Sake]]
* Voice actress: [[Takahashi Minami (voice Actor)|Takahashi Minami]]
* Type: Dance (Million Live!) / Angel ([[idolmaster million live! theater days|Theater days]]) / Ocean and Love ([[idolmaster PopLinks|PopLinks]])

h4. Appearance

title: nineball
body:
The [[mecha | Armored Core (AC)]] piloted by Hustler One and the main antagonist of [[Armored Core]] and [[Armored Core: Master of Arena]], often spelled "Nine-Ball". It is considered one of the strongest and most iconic ACs, due to its status in-game. 

During the events of Armored Core and Masters of Arena it is revealed [spoilers]there are multiple Nine-balls and Hustler One is actually an AI controlling them, created by and protects Raven's Nest system[/spoilers]. 

[[Nineball Seraph|Nine-Ball=Seraph]] is an upgraded version in Master of Arena and most common depiction.
[[Nine-Ball Onyx]], referred to as Nine-Ball or Baby's Breath in-game, is a recreation of the original Nine-Ball in [[Armored Core: Nine Breaker|Nine Breaker]] and [[armored core: nexus|Nexus]].

Nine-ball is a recurring element in the series and appears or is referenced in most games, often by association to number 9. References include, but not limited to: [[White Glint]]'s pilot and [[V.IV Rusty]] being ranked 9th in their respective games or [[HAL 826]]'s coloration and the shape of its head in [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon|VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

It is sometimes associated with [[Cirno]] from [[Touhou]] due to its status as the "strongest" AC and [[trait connection|connection to the number 9]] among fans of both series.
[[Nineball=Cirno]] is a [[fusion]] of the two, generally depicted as Cirno with Nine-ball's color scheme and boosters.

title: vixen_(armored_core)
body:
The AC [[mecha]] piloted by Raven [[Stinger (armored Core)|]] in [[Armored Core: Project Phantasma]].

It is a lightweight bipedal model with entirely custom-made parts and weaponry, where its weaponry is comprised of [[machine gun]] attached with [[underbarrel grenade launcher]], double [[energy blade|plasma torch]] attached to an [[arm shield]] and [[laser cannon|plasma cannon]] on its chest.

title: hal_826
body: IB-C03: HAL 826 A [[mecha]] that appears in [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]] and a Coral-powered C-weapon developed by the Rubicon Research Institute. While it is part of the Ibis Series, HAL 826 is the only one compatible with other AC parts among them and the only known C-weapon intended with manned use. As an AC, it can be classified as a semi-heavyweight bipedal model. It comes equipped with entirely Coral-based weaponry, each being [[energy gun|rifle]], [[energy blade|blade]], [[missile]] and [[energy barrier|shield]]. Its design elements pay homage to various iconic ACs from previous series. Its head's overall shape is reminiscent of [[nineball|Nine-Ball]] and [[Vixen (Armored Core)|]], where core and leg parts look similar to that of [[White Glint]]. Its default color scheme also seems to be inspired by Nine-Ball as well. It is piloted by [[Handler Walter]].

title: noelle_holiday
body:
A [[deer girl|reindeer]][[furry female|-like]] [[Deltarune]] character with [[reindeer antlers|antlers]] and [[buck teeth|prominent front teeth]]. She wears a [[checkered sweater vest]] with a [[skirt]] in the Overworld and a [[white robe]] in the Dark World.

Noelle is a classmate and childhood friend of [[Kris (deltarune)|]]. She lives with her mother, [[carol holiday|Carol]], while her father, [[rudolph holiday|Rudy]], is hospitalized with an unspecified illness. Her older sister, [[December Holiday]], is implied to be either missing or deceased.

Revealed during the Spamton Sweepstakes, Noelle runs a blog under the username "holidaygirl1225," where she shares game secrets, glitches, and theories. Several posts on the official [[Deltarune]] website are presented as in-character entries from her blog, starting [here](https://deltarune.com/code/). [spoiler]She also plays a central role in the [[Weird Route (Deltarune)|]].[/spoiler]

title: freddie_mercury
body:
Born [b]Farrokh Bulsara[/b]  (September 5, 1946 – November 24, 1991), this man was a British singer, songwriter and producer, best known as the lead vocalist and lyricist of the rock band [[Queen (band)|]]. As a performer, he was known for his flamboyant stage persona and powerful vocals over a four-octave range. 

It is also rumored that he is currently enrolled in [[Sakigake!! Cromartie Koukou|Cromartie High School]], but this has not been substantiated.

As an aside, he has been immortalized as an SH Figuarts articulated figure based on his Wembley 1986 concert outfit.

title: shrieker_(armored_core)
body:
An [[Armored Core]] [[mecha]] featured in Episode 8 "Asset Management" in the 2024 animated series [[Secret Level (series)|]].

Operated by an augmented pilot known as [b]The Pilot[/b], played by [[Keanu Reeves]], the SHRIEKER's design is a mixture of [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon|Balam's MELANDER frame]] with the [[armored core: for answer|Bernard and Felix Foundation's 063AN and the Omer]] [[TYPE-LAHIRE]]. The mech is infamous due to one scene in Secret Level where [spoilers]The Pilot kills an enemy pilot by using SHRIEKER's finger to kill the pilot in their cockpit[/spoilers].

title: ootani_shouhei
body: Ootani Shouhei (大谷 翔平, born July 5, 1994) is a Japanese professional baseball pitcher and designated hitter. Ootani played for the [[Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters]] from 2013-2017 and made his MLB debut in 2018 with the [[Los Angeles Angels]]. From the 2024 season he is signed to play for the [[Los Angeles Dodgers]], after signing an unprecedented 700 million USD contract with the team.

title: wendy_o._koopa
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]], she is one of the seven [[Koopalings]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]], being the only female member. Wendy appears in numerous platformers, serving as a world boss in one of the first seven worlds and also appears as a playable character in spin-offs, including [[Mario Kart 8]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]].

Like her siblings, Wendy uses her [[turtle shell|shell]] to attack and can be defeated by jumping on her head three times. She uses her magic [[wand]] to summon large [[ring]]s as projectiles and is quite agile, running and [[jumping]] during her boss fights. In [[New Super Mario Bros. U]], she is shown to be skilled at [[ice skating]] and is also a rather proficient [[swimming|swimmer]] in [[New Super Mario Bros. 2]].

Wendy is depicted as a spoiled brat, desiring wealth and prestige and is also fairly greedy. She has a quick temper, often going into a rage over little things and is stated to be a [[tomboy]]. She also has a rivalry with [[Princess Peach]] and [[Princess Daisy|Daisy]]. Like most of the Koopalings, she has a mostly [[yellow skin]] complexion, as well as a yellow head and wears two large [[gold bracelet|gold]] [[bangle]]s in place of the [[spiked bracelet]]s her brothers wear. She is average height and has a pink [[spiked shell]], [[thick lips|thick]] [[pink lips]] and wears a red [[pearl necklace]] and [[pink shoes|pink]] [[high heels]], being the only Koopaling wearing shoes. Even as the sole female Koopaling, she is notably [[bald female|bald]] and wears a [[pink bow|pink]] [[polka dot bow]] on her head.

She is named after Wendy O. Williams, the lead singer of the [[punk rock]] band Plasmatics.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31156788: Regular
* !asset #31244952: Dr. Wendy

h4. See also

* [[Koopalings]] 
* [[Princess Wendy O. Koopa]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Wendy":https://www.mariowiki.com/Wendy

title: slender_man
body:
An iconic supernatural entity and [[Creepypasta]].

Slender Man was created by Eric Knudsen on a [[Something Awful]] forum thread as part of a photoshop contest, where users were challenged to "create paranormal images". Eric was inspired to create Slender Man primarily by Stephen King's [[The Mist (stephen king)|]], Zach Parsons' [i]That Insidious Beast[/i], works of [[H P Lovecraft]] and [[shadow people]].

He quickly went viral, especially after the success of the derivative [[Marble Hornets]] web series, spawning numerous works of fanart, cosplay, other Creepypastas and even received his own mythos. Slender Man has also been adapted into various [[video game]]s, short films and movies and has arguably become the most famous Creepypasta of all time.

Slender Man is depicted as a very [[tall male|tall]], [[faceless]] man wearing a [[black suit]] and [[necktie]]. He has [[white skin]] and occasionally has [[tentacles]] protruding from his back. Stories of Slender Man often feature him [[stalking]], [[kidnapping]] or traumatizing people, particularly [[child|children]]. He is commonly associated with the [[forest]] or [[abandoned]] places and has the ability to [[teleportation|teleport]]. People who encounter Slender Man may also become afflicted with a sickness known as the [i]Slender Sickness[/i], which manifests with various symptoms.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2223499

h4. Original images

* !asset #30927416
* !asset #30927443

h4. See also

* [[Enderman]] - A [[Minecraft]] mob inspired by Slender Man

h4. External links

* "Creepypasta Wiki: The Slender Man":https://creepypasta.fandom.com/wiki/The_Slender_Man
* "Know Your Meme: Slender Man":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/slender-man
* "Original forum thread":https://forums.somethingawful.com/showthread.php?threadid=3150591&userid=0&perpage=40&pagenumber=3

title: aged_up
body:
When a character is portrayed as older (physically) than they usually are. Often, this is a character who is normally a teenager or young adult being shown as a (more) mature adult, or even elderly.

The opposite of [[aged down]].

h4. See Also

* [[aged down]]
* [[old]]
* [[age progression]]
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: arifureta_shokugyou_de_sekai_saikyou
body:
[b]Arifureta Shokugyou de Sekai Saikyou[/b] is a light novel written by Chuuni Suki (白米良 / 厨二好き) and illustrated by [[Takayaki]]. 

h4. Synopsis
Among the class that was transported to another world, Nagumo Hajime is an ordinary male student who doesn't have ambition nor aspiration in life, called "Incompetent" by his classmates. The class is summoned to become heroes and save a country from destruction, students of the class are blessed with cheat specs and cool job classes, but that's not the case with Hajime, his job class is a "Synergist" and his stats are very normal (mediocre). "Synergist," to put it in another word is just the artisan class. Being the weakest, he then falls to the depth of the abyss when he and his classmates are exploring a dungeon. What did he find in the depth of the abyss and can he survive?

h4. Characters
* [[Nagumo Hajime]]
* [[Yue (arifureta)|]]
* [[Shea Haulia]]
* [[Tio Clarce]]
* [[Shirasaki Kaori]]
* [[Yaegashi Shizuku]]
* [[Hatayama Aiko]]
* [[David Zahler]]
* [[Sonobe Yuuka]]

h4. Genre
Action  Adventure  Fantasy  Harem  Psychological  Romance  Seinen  

h4. External links
https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=113398
http://over-lap.co.jp/narou/865540550/

title: mike_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] do massive damage to surrounding enemies through the power of terrible [[bad singing]] .

In this form, Kirby wears a pair of [[red headphones|red]] [[headphones]] decorated with a [[yellow trim]] and a couple [[star print|stars]] on the sides. He also holds a [[microphone]].

title: tiptoes
body:
Maintaining one's [[balancing|balance]] on the ends of one's [[toes]]. Usually done [[standing]] but can be done in other positions as well.

Contrast with [[heel up]].

When doing it with [[ballet slippers|pointe shoes]], the technique is call [[en pointe]].

title: final_fantasy_xi
body:
The eleventh in a series of popular role-playing games by Square Enix Co., Ltd. The first in the series to go online, it is Square Enix's entry into the MMORPG market. It was first released on the Sony PlayStation 2 system in 2002 in Japan, then released in North America for the PC in 2003. It was re-released for the Microsoft Xbox 360 system in 2004. 

Being an MMORPG, there are no central characters, discounting [[adventurer (ff11)|the player]] themselves in a meta sense, but the numerous races and job classes are represented on Danbooru.

title: elc-001_(arknights)
body:
A Laterano Confession booth with an unusual serial number, ELC-001. The [spoilers]embodiment of [[Doctor (arknights)|]] in the Laterano dreamscape[/spoilers] in [i]The Masses' Travels[/i]. The code "ELC" is a reference to [spoilers]the last three letters of Doctor's true identity, Oracle, written in reverse.[/spoilers]

Not to be confused with [[Confess-47 (arknights)|]], whose serial number is LC-047.

title: soga_no_tojiko
body:
The "Departed Spirit of the Children of the Gods".

Stage 5 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]].

She is a very practical woman who can use coarse language. She also appears to be a foil to Futo's air-headed, jovial nature. In spite of the language she uses, she's actually kind, though short-tempered. Her friendship/rivalry with [[Mononobe no Futo]] led her to be unable to reincarnate like Futo and [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]]. Soga instead came back as a ghost with two [[ghost tail]]s in the place of legs. Exactly where her body transitions from human-like to ghost-like is unclear, due to the [[long dress|long]] [[green dress]] that she wears. She has [[short hair|]] [[green hair]] and [[green eyes]] and also wears a [[black hat|black]] [[tate eboshi]] like Futo. 

Her name came from "Tojiko no Iratsume":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/刀自古郎女], a daughter of [[Soga no Umako]] and consort of [[Shoutoku Taishi]]. Since her name comes from the consort of the character on whom [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]] was based, the two are often depicted by fans as a [[couple]].

h4. See also

* [[Yatteyan'yo]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Soga no Tojiko":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Soga_no_Tojiko
